1.name: Adamantoise
1.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant for 200,000 MGP.
1.description: “ Summon forth your adamantoise mount. He(?) is actually quite faster than he appears. Native to the Near Eastern island of Thavnair, adamantoises were long thought to be impossible to domesticate. However, through the efforts of both Ul'dahn naturalists and thaumaturges, a handful have been successfully trained not only to accept riders, but also wield ancient magicks which allow the colossal scalekin to fly. — In-game description

2.name: Aerodynamics System
2.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement In a Blaze of Glory V by winning 100 Frontline PvP matches on Fields of Glory with any of the Grand Companies.
2.description: “ Summon forth your aerodynamics system─marvel of ancient Allagan ingenuity. Unearthed in the eastern lowlands of Coerthas, engineers surmise that this particular Allagan drone would likely have been used in aerial defense, although its weaponry functions are now beyond repair. Even so, it is still quite convenient as a transportation device. — In-game description

3.name: Aeturna
3.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Vintage Vogue by speaking with Koh Rabntah while in possession of all four of the enaretos accessories.
3.description: “ Summon forth the aeturna, an imposing feline that boasts far more than the standard nine lives. During an expedition to Ilsabard in his younger years, Emperor Xande is said to have come upon this fearsome beast. As its name, meaning “eternal,” would suggest, it possesses remarkable vitality, and in addition to serving as an armored warbeast, it was also a subject in the Allagans' research into immortality. — In-game description

4.name: Ahriman
4.acquired_by: Purchased from Jonathas in Old Gridania for 6 Achievement Certificates.
4.description: “ Summon forth a riding ahriman, bound to this realm with powerful magicks guaranteed to never fade. Though little is known of the void and the creatures which call the extra-dimensional realm home, scholars have discovered that there is a strict hierarchy amongst voidsent consisting of twelve distinct tiers. Ahrimans are believed to fall into the fifth, making them formidable foes...when not enthralled by curses. — In-game description

5.name: Air Force
5.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Sigmascape V4.0 (Savage).
5.description: “ Call into battle Air Force, a flying weapon of masculine destruction somehow smuggled from Omega's Sigmascape. From the amount of ordinance equipped, one can gather that this oddly shaped airship was employed in battle. However, being from the Sigmascape, who employed it and when are anyone's guess. The shark maw painted on its bow suggests an underwater civilization. — In-game description

6.name: Air-wheeler A9
6.acquired_by: Purchased from Neon in Solution Nine for 7,500,000 gil.
6.description: “ Designed and built in Alexandria, this single-rider flying vehicle uses electrope to convert lightning to wind energy, which it expels to produce levitation and propulsion. While air-wheelers are extensively employed by the military, the A9 is a civilian model and does not come fitted with armaments. — In-game description

7.name: Air-wheeler C9
7.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of AAC Cruiserweight M4 (Savage).
7.description: “ Summon forth your air-wheeler C9, and turn heads all over Solution Nine. The C9 is the latest flying passenger vehicle to be developed in Alexandria. Propelled by six electrope thrusters that serve as wheels when driven on the ground, it performs equally well on land as it does in the air, and is the object of desire for the youths of Solution Nine. — In-game description

8.name: Aithon
8.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Bowl of Embers (Extreme).
8.description: “ Summon forth Aithon, the legendary steed favored of the primal Ifrit. Its breath is said to be as hot as the seventh hell. Legend states that the Lord of the Inferno, Ifrit, forged this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the Amalj'aa in sacrifice. — In-game description

9.name: Al-iklil
9.acquired_by: Attain the Achievement A Complete History by collecting all 50 Field Record entries.
9.description: “ Summon forth Al-iklil, a stylish hovering craft designed to carry up to two riders. Any more and it may not heed you. A gift from Fran to the Bozjan Resistance, this craft hovers by the power of skystones, crystals that allow entire masses of land to levitate. Its name is said to be derived from an ancient Ivalician word meaning “crown.” — In-game description

10.name: Albino Karakul
10.acquired_by: Purchased from Enie in The Firmament for 8,400 Skybuilders' Scrips.
10.description: “ Summon forth your albino karakul, a black sheep among its kind. Which is to say it's white. Though karakuls ordinarily have black fleece, this creature raised in the paddocks of House Haillenarte was born snowy white. This rarest of qualities spared it a fate at the dining table, and it grew to such a size as to be able to bear people upon its fluffy back. — In-game description

11.name: Alkonost
11.acquired_by: Purchased from Nesvaaz in Radz-at-Han (10.6, 10) for 3 Resplendent Feathers from Endwalker treasure maps.
11.description: “ Summon forth your alkonost, an imposing antlered avian native to northern Ilsabard. Captured in the Bozjan wilderness, this creature was passed around as a curiosity before eventually being released again. From the start, it seemed unperturbed in the presence of men, leading some to believe it was trained by an imperial beastmaster. — In-game description

12.name: Alpaca
12.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Main Scenario Quest Dawntrail.
12.description: “ Known as a Pelupelu merchant's best friend, the alpaca has long been raised as livestock in the mountainous regions of Tural. They are prized for their wool, a staple material in traditional textiles, as well as their sure-footedness, which sees them employed as both pack animals and cavalry mounts. — In-game description

13.name: Alte Roite
13.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Deltascape V4.0 (Savage)
13.description: “ Summon forth Alte Roite, fantastical ur-being generated by Omega within the Deltascape. While none can be certain the exact intentions of a self-aware interdimensional construct, logic suggests this winged aberration is a reimagination of Alte Roite─a legendary wizard who is said could take the shape of a dragon at will. — In-game description

14.name: Amaro
14.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement A Life of Adventure IV by getting every Disciple of War and Disciple of Magic that starts below level 80 (excluding Reaper, Sage, and Blue Mage) to level 80.
14.description: “ Summon forth your amaro, Norvrandt's favorite beast of burden. Of all the mounts seen in Norvrandt, naught is more ubiquitous than the amaro. Originally created by the mages of ancient Ronka, who selectively bred the flightless cama, present-day beasts carry the seed of their ancestors, which may manifest in the form of superior intellect. — In-game description

15.name: Amber Draught Chocobo
15.acquired_by: Purchased from any Calamity Salvager for 8 Gold Chocobo Feathers. Gold Chocobo Feathers can be obtained through the Recruit a Friend campaign, or through World Population Balancing Incentives.
15.description: “ Summon forth your amber draught chocobo, a rare breed large and strong enough to bear two riders. To Ishgardians , red represents true love and loyalty. To this wild chocobo from the Dravanian forelands , it meant capture at the hands of hunters who easily found a red chocobo sticking out like a sore thumb in the midst of all his yellow brethren. — In-game description

16.name: Ambulario
16.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Dressed to Impresario during All Saints' Wake (2025).
16.description: “ Summon forth your Ambulario, and ride in the delightfully fiendish spirit of All Saints' Wake. Designed in the fiendish likeness of the Impresario, the leader of the Continental Circus, this automaton incorporates an enchantment which allows it to weave festive glamours. Its head also produces a satisfyingly sonorous bonk when struck, for a more mundane sort of amusement. — In-game description

17.name: Ancient Airship
17.acquired_by: Purchase from the Expedition Antiquarian in South Horn for 5,000 Enlightenment Silver Pieces.
17.description: “ Summon your ancient airship, a magic-propelled vessel capable of bearing you and three companions. Discovered on the Occult Crescent, this ancient airship is powered not by ceruleum like modern vessels, but rather relies on magic to manipulate wind-aspected aether and generate propulsion. As this magic must be provided by passengers, it is recommended to ride in a group in order to avoid exhaustion. — In-game description

18.name: Anden III
18.acquired_by: Complete the quest A Labor of Leaf which requires Custom Delivery level 5 with Anden.
18.description: “ Summon forth Anden III. It has a mouth, but it cannot scream. In gratitude for your kindness, the pixie Eo Tyr gifted you this peculiar ambulatory plant, which they created from the leaves of the original Anden after pruning him. While it resembles its namesake, it lacks the power of speech, and there is no telling what thoughts lie behind its permanently horrified expression. — In-game description

19.name: Antelope Doe
19.acquired_by: Purchased from Enie in The Firmament for 8,400 Skybuilders' Scrips.
19.description: “ Summon forth your antelope doe, a female creature identifiable by the bluish tinge of its fur. Denizens of grasslands, antelopes once ranged as far as Coerthas before the Calamity buried the region in snow. Though coveted for their meat and milk, the creatures have eluded full domestication owing to their ornery temperament. — In-game description

20.name: Antelope Stag
20.acquired_by: Purchased from Enie in The Firmament for 30 Fête Tokens. Randomly drops from Fête Present.
20.description: “ Summon forth your antelope stag, a male creature identifiable by its horns, striped body, and...impressive size. Swift and sure-footed, antelopes have been favored as mounts by the tribes of Abalathia's Spine since ancient times. In recent years, ancient magicks have also made it possible for the creatures to fly so long as the rider has sufficient reserves of aether. — In-game description

21.name: Apocryphal Bahamut
21.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Sidequest " Wings of Hope" after acquiring the 7 Lynx mounts from Endwalker extreme trials.
21.description: “ Summon forth your apocryphal Bahamut, an embodiment of the fallen wyrm's burning desire to be free...and apparently carry you on a sofa. This draconic entity is brought forth by blowing into the horn you received from the wandering minstrel while holding in your heart Bahamut's song recorded by the Heimdall. Thus imbued with hopes and dreams, it desires nothing more than to soar the boundless skies and recognizes your free-spirited self as its master. — In-game description

22.name: Aquamarine Carbuncle
22.description: “ Summon forth your Aquamarine Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of aquamarine geometry. Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large aquamarine, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima. — In-game description

23.name: Archon Throne
23.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant for 750,000 MGP.
23.description: “ Summon forth your Archon throne. Don't call it a high chair. Despite claims that it was once the chair of Louisoix Leveilleur , former residents of Sharlayan have confirmed that it is naught more than an ordinary furnishing enchanted by a Great Gubal Library bibliophile who was tired of not being able to reach the upper shelves. — In-game description

24.name: Argos
24.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Main Scenario Quest Endwalker.
24.description: “ Summon forth Argos, Venat's faithful familiar, to bear you places while you marvel at the softness of his golden coat. Created by Venat, this dog-like familiar lends his back only to those who have won his favor─which you already had by the time you first met him in Mare Lamentorum owing to the quirks of time travel. — In-game description

25.name: Arion
25.acquired_by: Purchase the Collector's Edition or Digital Collector's Edition of Endwalker. (account-wide)
25.description: “ Summon forth Arion, the heavenly steed of unmatched swiftness. Legends speak of a majestic and unwaveringly loyal horse who would never fail to deliver its master from peril. Such myths were founded in fact, as the divine steed has descended from the heavens to seek one possessed of a true and virtuous heart, with whom it may right the wrongs of the world. — In-game description

26.name: Ark
26.acquired_by: Purchase the Collector's Edition or Digital Collector's Edition of Dawntrail. (account-wide)
26.description: “ Summon forth your Ark, a bipedal warmachina disguised as an airship——or an airship disguised as a bipedal warmachina, if you prefer. Seeking to develop an advanced transforming airship, the engineers of Garlond Ironworks turned tothe expertise of a former Illuminati scientist. The result was a machina that can convert between bipedal and assault craft forms in the blink of an eye. — In-game description

27.name: Arrhidaeus
27.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Alexander - The Soul of the Creator (Savage).
27.description: “ Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Oh, oh, oh, Arrhidaeus. Summon forth your Arrhidaeus. Fabricated within Alexander 's internal manufactories, Arrhidaeus was primarily used to wreak temporal disruption on any and all invaders. This particular construct saw its weapons systems overridden following capture, and now serves as a glorified transport module. — In-game description

28.name: Astrope
28.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement I Hope Mentor Will Notice Me VI by completing 2,000 duties via the Duty Roulette: Mentor.
28.description: “ Summon forth Astrope. A fully grown pegasus large enough to bear you and a companion across gentle skies. The emergent studies of winged horses had to be rewritten with a single sighting of Astrope, confirming that adult pegasi are not only enormous in size, but also possessed of a horn. Wary of most, Astrope only allows those of gentle heart to climb upon its back─a back large enough to seat two! — In-game description

29.name: Auspicious Kamuy
29.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Jade Stoa (Extreme). Purchased from Eschina for 99 Byakko Totems.
29.description: “ Summon forth the auspicious kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics. Said to be swaddled in the very winds of heaven, this majestic creature was once a brutal killer of man. A chance meeting with auspice lord Byakko, however, saw the bloodlust in its heart fade. — In-game description

30.name: Automatoise
30.acquired_by: Purchased from Ryubool Ja at Tuliyollal (X:13.9 Y:13.5) for 3,200 Sack of Nuts.
30.description: “ A weapon of war developed in Origenics, this giant tortoise has been augmented with a reinforced electrope skeleton and servomotors in order to enhance defense and strength. As the underlying creature is ordinarily mild-mannered, it is infused with the soul of a savage predator to lend it ferocity at the onset of battle. — In-game description

31.name: Barreltender
31.acquired_by: Purchased from Splendors Vendor in Solution Nine (X:9.1, Y:13.2) for 100 Mount Tokens (effectively 100,000 Orange Gatherers' Scrips).
31.description: “ Summon forth your barreltender, a sabotender possessed of a hulking frame that has earned it its name. Native to the arid wilds of Xak Tural, this abnormally well-built sabotender resolved to further hone its flesh after meeting its match in an adventurer. As part of a rigorous training regime, it willingly and tirelessly carries you hither and yon. — In-game description

32.name: Battle Bear
32.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Tank You, Warrior III by completing 300 dungeons (lv. 61 and above), extreme trials (lv. 61 and above), high-level duty roulette dungeons, or duty roulette leveling duties as a Warrior.
32.description: “ Summon forth your battle bear, fully armored to protect the savage beast from singeing its lustrous fur on the smoldering carnage left in its wake. The bears of Abalathia's Spine are not known to suffer the presence of man in their territory, let alone allow one to mount their backs and command them hither and yon. Then what, pray tell, has come over this particular specimen? Perhaps one look into your inner beast convinced the creature that submission spelled survival. — In-game description

33.name: Battle Lion
33.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Tank You, Paladin III by completing 300 dungeons (lv. 61 and above), extreme trials (lv. 61 and above), high-level duty roulette dungeons, or duty roulette leveling duties as a Paladin.
33.description: “ Summon forth your battle lion, fully armored to protect the majestic beast from the dangers of close combat. There was a time when members of Ul'dah's elite Sultansworn strode the Steps of Nald and Thal atop silver-plated lions, striking fear and awe into the mewling masses. An effort to return to those days of glory has seen the summoning of several of Thavnair's most prominent beast tamers to the Rose of the Desert. — In-game description

34.name: Battle Panther
34.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Tank You, Dark Knight III by completing 300 dungeons (lv. 61 and above), extreme trials (lv. 61 and above), high-level duty roulette dungeons, or duty roulette leveling duties as a Dark Knight.
34.description: “ Summon forth your battle panther, fully armored to protect the stealthy beast from the occasional poison dart, poison arrow, poison-tipped spear, poison spell, and any poison words directed its way. History tells us that no dark hero's story is complete without the companionship of a wily panther. Their sable coat, their savage nature, their attunement with the umbral, their thirst for blood. It is as if the gods created these creatures in the image of a dark knight...or perhaps it was the other way around. — In-game description

35.name: Battle Tiger
35.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Tank You, Gunbreaker III by completing 300 dungeons (lv. 61 and above), extreme trials (lv. 61 and above), high-level duty roulette dungeons, or duty roulette leveling duties as a Gunbreaker.
35.description: “ Summon forth your battle tiger, now with 100% more sharp things with which to terrorize your foes. In the region of Bozja in Ilsabard, the sabertooth tiger has long been employed in warfare as part of infantry. Many soldiers developed an enduring bond with the beasts, whom they would affectionately refer to as their “kittens.” — In-game description

36.name: Behemoth
36.acquired_by: Purchased from Jonathas in Old Gridania for 6 Achievement Certificates.
36.description: “ Summon your mighty behemoth, trained from birth to carry you...not trample you underfoot like an ant. Immediately following the Calamity , an adventurer returning to Gridania from Falcon's Nest in Coerthas claims to have happened upon a den of baby behemoths who had lost their mother. Despite objections from friends and family alike, she kept the beasts, eventually training them to serve as mounts . — In-game description

37.name: Bennu
37.description: “ Summon forth the mythical bennu. Very few have had the privilege of viewing this bird up close. This bird was reborn after drinking deep of the aether that flowed forth from the immortal Phoenix, who appeared in the skies of Carteneau during the Calamity . Named after a legendary bird, bennu means “a shining object, rising in brilliance.” — In-game description

38.name: Big Shell
38.acquired_by: Purchased from Enie in The Firmament (x12.0,y14.0) for 8,400 Skybuilders' Scrip
38.description: “ Summon forth your big shell mount, which is ironically rather small. Still quite big for a crab, though. Raised by a Qiqirn culinary connoisseur, this carefree crustacean formed a bond of friendship with its keeper, and in so doing, escaped the cookpot. Though it may not be the most obvious choice for a mount, its smooth, round shell makes it one of the more comfortable. — In-game description

39.name: Black Chocobo
39.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Main Scenario Quest Divine Intervention.
39.description: “ Summon de forth your black de chocobo. A purebred Ishgardian black chocobo , trained from birth by House Fortemps knight, Ser Haurchefant , and presented to you in a gesture of true friendship. The bird is slightly more muscular than you expected and exhibits the strange habit of squatting when left to itself. — In-game description

40.name: Black Pegasus
40.acquired_by: Drops from Gold-trimmed Sacks ( Palace of the Dead floors 151-200). Drops from Materiel Container 3.0.
40.description: “ Summon forth a black pegasus─winged horse of legend and bringer of death. While uncommon, tales of pegasi black as ink can be found amongst the folklore of countless tribes. One similarity, however, can be observed in nearly all the renditions─that those unworthy of the steed will have their very life essence sapped the moment they climb upon its back. — In-game description

41.name: Blackjack
41.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant for 4,000,000 MGP.
41.description: “ Summon forth the Blackjack , or rather, its scale prototype. Exactly where inside it you ride is a mystery best left unanswered. Commissioned by Chairman Tatabaru of Highwind Skyways to develop a new airship, the engineers of Garlond Ironworks produced this scale prototype for testing purposes. Despite its diminutive size, it boasts an impressive loading capacity, and can easily carry you and a few friends. — In-game description

42.name: Blissful Kamuy
42.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Emanation (Extreme). Purchased from Eschina for 99 Bliss Totems.
42.description: “ Summon forth your blissful kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics. Believe it or not, this monstrous canine did not always glow, only achieving its heavenly effulgence upon receiving the blessing of Lakshmi after being offered to the Lady of Bliss by her loyal Ananta dreamers. — In-game description

43.name: Bluefeather Lynx
43.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Endsinger's Aria. Purchased from Nesvaaz for 99 Ultimatum Totems.
43.description: “ Summon forth your bluefeather lynx mount, which could be what a certain feathered familiar might look like as a large, winged feline. A phantom creation composed of the esoteric power of dynamis. It is believed that the Endsinger brought forth this mysterious entity, but for what purpose is unclear. Could it be a tribute, perhaps, bestowed upon one who has overcome her aria of despair? — In-game description

44.name: Bomb Palanquin
44.acquired_by: Purchased from Kobold Vendor in Outer La Noscea for 120,000 gil after achieving Rank 4 (Trusted) reputation with the Kobold society.
44.description: “ Summon forth a bevy of bombs who will bear you in comfort upon a hovering palanquin. Upon learning that his creations were forever lacking the power to combust, 789th Order Acolyte Ba Go did what any master of explosives would─attach the bombs to the corners of an iron bench and create a floating coach. — In-game description

45.name: Boreas
45.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Akh Afah Amphitheatre (Extreme).
45.description: “ Summon forth Boreas, the legendary steed favored of the primal Shiva. His breath is said to beget the winter's storms. Legend states that the Lady of Frost, Shiva, birthed this magicked steed from a unicorn offered by her followers in sacrifice. — In-game description

46.name: Brachiosaur
46.acquired_by: Purchased from Ryubool Ja at Tuliyollal (X:13.9 Y:13.5) for 3,200 Sack of Nuts.
46.description: “ Summon forth your brachiosaur, a rare prehistoric creature sighted in frontier lands. Belonging to an ancient and enormous species, this juvenile creature was hatched from an egg found in the wilds by a hunter-scholar. As its body burgeoned, so too did its appetite for exploration, and it eventually found in you a worthy master to follow. — In-game description

47.name: Branchbearer
47.acquired_by: Purchased from Veerul Ja in Yak T'el for 18 Mamool Ja Nanook after achieving Rank 4 (Trusted) reputation with the Mamool Ja society.
47.description: “ Summon forth your branchbearer. If it looks like a bird, flies like a bird, and cries like a bird, then it...could be a predatorial seedkin disguised as a bird. The branchbearer is employed as a companion plant in Gok Golma, where it protects crops by deterring pests with its aetheric emissions. In the past, the species was so aggressive that it was known to actively hunt animals for sustenance, but the Doppro people have succeeded in their domestication. — In-game description

48.name: Broken Heart (left)
48.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Lessons in Love during Valentione's Day (2018). Purchased from the House Valentione Maid for 6 Valentione's Day Chocolates during Valentione's Day (2018). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
48.description: “ Summon forth your broken heart─a magicked chair representing the left half of a Valentione's Day heart. Burdened with a warehouse of unsold broken heart chairs, House Valentione came up with the diabolic plan to repurpose the cushions with cloudsbreath and peddle them to the unknowing masses as flying mounts. Lady Lisette dreams of one day riding the hearts on her honeymoon. — In-game description

49.name: Broken Heart (right)
49.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Lessons in Love during Valentione's Day (2018). Purchased from the House Valentione Maid for 6 Valentione's Day Chocolates during Valentione's Day (2018). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
49.description: “ Summon forth your broken heart─a magicked chair representing the right half of a Valentione's Day heart. Burdened with a warehouse of unsold broken heart chairs, House Valentione came up with the diabolic plan to repurpose the cushions with cloudsbreath and peddle them to the unknowing masses as flying mounts. — In-game description

50.name: Burabura Chochin
50.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Mononopeke by unlocking all exorcism records on Mount Rokkon.
50.description: “ Summon forth your burabura chochin, a kindred spirit in wandering. Contrary to expectation, this lantern ghost did not care to haunt people, and was content to simply wander Mount Rokkon. When it saw you similarly wandering, it took you for a kindred spirit and decided to follow you wherever the wind should blow. — In-game description

51.name: Calydontis
51.acquired_by: Purchased from Khloe Aliapoh for 1 Khloe's Gold Certificate of Commendation Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
51.description: “ Summon forth Calydontis. He's wild but he's yours. Once a dreaded presence in its forest domain, this lord among wild boars met its match in a band of dauntless adventurers. Having thus learned to bow before the strong, it found a master in you. — In-game description

52.name: Cavalry Drake
52.acquired_by: Purchased from Amalj'aa Vendor in Southern Thanalan for 120,000 gil after achieving Rank 4 (Trusted) reputation with the Amalj'aa society.
52.description: “ Summon your cavalry drake, trained by the drake whisperer of the Brotherhood of Ash. Training a cavalry drake is a long and arduous process that begins the moment the scalekin hatches. Never allowed to see its mother, the creature is raised solely in the presence of a drake whisperer while being weaned on the incendiary glands of aged battle drakes to ensure it is both submissive and deadly. — In-game description

53.name: Cavalry Elbst
53.acquired_by: Purchased from Sahagin Vendor in Western La Noscea for 120,000 gil after achieving Rank 4 (Trusted) reputation with the Sahagin society.
53.description: “ Summon your cavalry elbst, raised from an egg by Pahh of Novv's Clutch. To ensure his elbst do not find themselves at a disadvantage to swift-running chocobos, Pahh of Novv's Clutch clips the webbing on their feet at a young age, rendering them more capable of achieving high speeds on land─though they will ever be slower than their brethren while underwater. — In-game description

54.name: Centurio Tiger
54.acquired_by: Complete the achievement You Got Game by defeating 3,000 Rank A Elite Marks and 2,000 Rank S Elite Marks.
54.description: “ Summon forth your Centurio tiger, one mark the Clan actually does not want seen slain. In a rare display of misguided compassion, a member of Clan Centurio returned from a Hunt with the cub of a slain S-rank mark. Unable to grant it mercy, the veteran took to caring for the beast until his deceit was discovered and his membership revoked. But by then, not a single member could bring themselves to harm the pet they had all come to love. — In-game description

55.name: Cerberus
55.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Savage Queen of Swords I by completing the level 80 duty Delubrum Reginae (Savage).
55.description: “ Summon forth your Cerberus mount. Be warned, however, that riding into a peaceful village on the back of a gigantic, slavering, three-headed hellhound may cause quite a stir among the locals. In addition to its immense strength and three gaping maws lined with razor-sharp fangs, this voidsent boasts incredible longevity, having lived since the Third Astral Era. The collars, of Allagan design, are believed to make it as tame as a puppy, though it may simply be biding its time before devouring its keeper. — In-game description

56.name: Ceremony Chocobo
56.acquired_by: Included with a Gold or Platinum Ceremony of Eternal Bonding plan: Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($10 / £5.75 / €7 / ¥1100) (Gold Plan) Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($20 / £11.50 / €14 / ¥2200) (Platinum Plan).
56.description: “ Summon forth your ceremony chocobo, large enough to bear both you and your special someone. Raised by Ishgard 's master breeders for beauty and purity of stock, its snow white feathers are natural and, though fully developed, as soft as down. Temperament-wise, the bird is remarkably docile and one of few breeds who will allow dual riders upon its back. — In-game description

57.name: Chandelier of First Light
57.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Faerie Favors by speaking with Aenc Daen while in possession of all four of the accessories of the First Light.
57.description: “ Summon forth your chandelier of First Light, and live like tomorrow doesn't exist. Like it doesn't exist. A furnishing at the Church of the First Light, this chandelier was imbued with levitation magicks to prevent it from falling and causing injury. In a development the church could not have foreseen, it has since been enhanced by fae enchantments and made able to soar the skies while bearing a rider. — In-game description

58.name: Chocobo Carriage
58.description: “ Summon forth your chocobo carriage to ferry your friends around in comfort. A ubiquitous mode of transportation in Eorzea , the chocobo carriage is kept aloft by ceruleum gas-filled bladders. This technology traces its origins to an early Ixali dirigible that crashed in the Twelveswood and was seized by Gridanian authorities. — In-game description

59.name: Chocorpokkur
59.acquired_by: Lawson promotional event (Japan) Butterfinger promotion (May 2021, North America) Twitter sweepstakes (July 2023) Twitch viewer campaign (July 2024)
59.description: “ Summon forth a chocorpokkur, which is... Well, perhaps you had best see it for yourself. This bizarre creature is the result of an enormous korpokkur coming into contact with vast amounts of chocolate. It has since taken to journeying far and wide to deliver sweet treats to anyone who does not immediately flee at the sight of it. — In-game description

60.name: Chrysomallos
60.acquired_by: Purchased from Edelina in Mor Dhona (x22,y5) for 50,000,000 gil.
60.description: “ Summon forth Chrysomallos, the golden ram of legend─though legend doesn't seem to say anything about illusory coins spilling forth endlessly... Instead of the white commonly seen in its kind, the fleece of this sheep is a remarkable golden hue. While the seller insisted that it is the golden ram of legend, as with all such claims, this should be taken with a pinch of salt. Only time and perhaps a new growth of wool will reveal the creature's true nature. — In-game description

61.name: Circus Ahriman
61.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Fear and Delight during All Saints' Wake (2019). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
61.description: “ Summon forth your Circus ahriman, a voidsent bred by the Continental Circus. Raised in hopes that its Dread Gaze would reap a bountiful harvest of terror, this ahriman proved a disappointment. It has since found a new calling as an adventurer's trusty mount. — In-game description

62.name: Citrine Carbuncle
62.description: “ Summon forth your Citrine Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of citrine geometry. Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large citrine, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima. — In-game description

63.name: Cloud Mallow
63.acquired_by: Purchased from Mogmul Mogbelly in The Churning Mists (x16,y29) for 200,000 gil after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) with the Moogle society.
63.description: “ Summon forth a cloud mallow. It will carry you wherever the wind blows. Or, wherever you steer it. While cloud mallows grow naturally in the Churning Mists, some of the inhabitants of Moghome have spent generations cultivating their own seeds to allow for stronger stems and larger yields of mallow puffs, a sprinkling of which can stimulate even the most lethargic of moogles to work with unbridled joy. — In-game description

64.name: Coeurl
64.acquired_by: Reward for purchasing the Collector's Edition or Digital Collector's Edition of A Realm Reborn. (account-wide)
64.description: “ Summon your fleet-footed battle coeurl, trained from a pup to recognize you as a friend...not food. Native to the jungles of the Near East , coeurls were only recently introduced to Eorzea , brought over from faraway lands such as Thavnair by Ul'dahn nobles who thought to breed them as pets. Now, but a handful of skilled tamers living in recluse on the Pearl are said to be able to train them. — In-game description

65.name: Company Chocobo
65.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Feature Quest My Little Chocobo after joining one of the Grand Companies, which is required by Main Scenario Quest Operation Archon.
65.description: “ Summon your Grand Company-issued battle chocobo. Born and bred in the city–state of Ishgard , the majority of company chocobos are geldings of the rouncey variety; however, massive destriers and miniature Belah'dian jennets are also raised to accommodate the builds of Roegadyn and Lalafellin riders respectively. — In-game description

66.name: Construct 14
66.acquired_by: Purchased from Resistance Quartermaster in The Bozjan Southern Front for 180 Bozjan Clusters. Random drop from a bronze or silver random overworld treasure coffer in The Occult Crescent: South Horn.
66.description: “ Summon forth your Construct 14. Will dispose of friend and foe alike if so commanded, so be careful what you wish for. During their excavation in the Clockwork City of Goug , the IVth Imperial Legion discovered a host of worker automata, which they repurposed for war. As the name suggests, this particular construct is the fourteenth to undergo such a transformation. — In-game description

67.name: Construct VI-S
67.acquired_by: Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
67.description: “ Summon forth your Construct VI-S. Painted red so it goes faster. Theoretically. This flashy golem was constructed by a band of commerce-minded kobolds hoping to establish regular trade with their seafaring neighbors. Coated in Lominsan red, propulsion power is apparently enhanced by as much as thirty percent. — In-game description

68.name: Construct VII
68.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement One Steppe at a Time V by winning 100 Frontline PvP matches on Onsal Hakair with any of the Grand Companies.
68.description: “ Summon forth your Construct VII. Rumors that it is heavily based on an Ivalician design are entirely unfounded. Well, almost. Having taken prisoner what they thought was an automaton during a skirmish with the kobolds, Maelstrom officers were shocked to find that it was instead a type of synthetic golem─but not so shocked as to not immediately bring it to Naldiq & Vymelli's for repair and later sale. — In-game description

69.name: Cosmoboard
69.acquired_by: Purchase from Mesouaidonque in Phaenna for 60 Phaenna Token Booklets.
69.description: “ Deploy your cosmoboard, and shred up the cosmos (figuratively) wherever you go. Originally used to convey workers around Sinus Ardorum as part of the Cosmoliner network, this hovering board has undergone modification to incorporate a crystal power source. The result is a personal mode of transportation that is unbound to set routes, and looks radical besides. — In-game description

70.name: Crescent Moon
70.description: “ Summon forth your crescent moon mount. By all accounts more comfortable to perch upon than one shaped like a full moon. Designed in the likeness of a crescent moon, this magicked gondola was being kept in storage in Sharlayan, where it was classified as a gift. While its origin is undisclosed, the automaton that accompanies the contraption offers a telling clue. — In-game description

71.name: Cruise Chaser
71.description: “ Summon forth your Cruise Chaser to cruise along in style as you give chase to your foes. Created by the genius minds of the Illuminati, this warmachina is capable of assuming bipedal and airship forms to adapt to the changing conditions of battle. Smitten by its design, it is said that a certain warmachina fanatic has a mind to produce a miniature version. — In-game description

72.name: Dais of Darkness
72.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Cloud of Darkness (Chaotic) Purchased from Uah'shepya in Solution Nine (8.6, 13.5) for 75 Clouddark Demimateria II.
72.description: “ Summon forth your dais of Darkness. Will not vanish beneath your feet after a set duration. A piece of the battlefield created by the Cloud of Darkness, upon which only those recognized by the being may set foot. While it has sent countless foes plummeting into endless void, by triumphing over its maker, you appear to have gained control over it. — In-game description

73.name: Dark Lanner
73.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Nidhogg's Rage Purchased from Bertana for 99 Horde Totems.
73.description: “ Summon forth the dark lanner. Favored of Nidhogg, it fearlessly soars the skies of the Churning Mists. Consumed by malice, these birds roost in Nidhogg's lair, and regularly bathe themselves in the aetheric tempests surrounding the Aery. Sight of their glowing wings outside the Churning Mists can set the commonfolk into a panic, as they are thought to be the Horde's harbingers of death. — In-game description

74.name: Deinonychus
74.acquired_by: Drops in The Dalriada - Final Boss Chest. Random drop from a bronze or silver random overworld treasure coffer in The Occult Crescent: South Horn.
74.description: “ Summon forth your deinonychus. Cleverer than the average prehistoric carnivore. Native to the southern regions of Ilsabard, the deinonychus is cousin to the raptors that inhabit the Twelveswood. Possessed of superior intelligence, as seen in its habit of hunting in pairs, the beasts have been employed in warfare since antiquity. — In-game description

75.name: Demi-Ozma
75.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement " We're on Your Side I" by completing The Baldesion Arsenal in The Forbidden Land, Eureka Hydatos.
75.description: “ Call into battle Demi-Ozma─the round mound of spellbound. After concluding that Ozma of the Weeping City was but a preliminary attempt to weave an aether-based simulacrum of the Eurekan phenomenon Proto Ozma , the Students of Baldesion endeavored to apply similar magicks in the creation of what they dubbed “Demi-Ozma,” hoping to learn what makes the entity tick. — In-game description

76.name: Demi-Phoinix
76.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Asphodelos: The Fourth Circle (Savage).
76.description: “ Summon forth Demi-Phoinix. Because four wings are better than two and three heads better than one. This entity is a recreation of the being found imprisoned inside Pandæmonium. The original was the fruit of the ancients' research into immortal birds, but owing to its volatility, it was branded a failure. — In-game description

77.name: Demon Haul
77.acquired_by: Attain the achievement A Fork to Be Reckoned With I by completing The Forked Tower: Blood.
77.description: “ Summon forth your demon haul, a dreaded guardian-turned-mode of transport. This formerly inanimate block of stone was brought to ghastly life by way of arcane patterns engraved in blood. Though created in bygone times to repel trespassers as a guardian, the removal of its core has rendered it harmless while additionally allowing it to serve as a mode of transport. — In-game description

78.name: Demonic Lanner
78.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Containment Bay Z1T9 (Extreme). Purchased from Bertana for 99 Demon Totems.
78.description: “ Summon forth your Demonic lanner─a symbol of justice for the Zurvan-worshipping races which once thrived on the southern continent of Meracydia. The centaurs of ancient Meracydia believed that their mighty god Zurvan would send out his lanner before a battle to inform his enemies of their impending defeat. — In-game description

79.name: Dhalmel
79.acquired_by: Potential reward from the Kupo of Fortune.
79.description: “ Summon forth your dhalmel, a towering herbivore native to the Sea of Clouds. While attempting to nibble at a tree on a nearby isle, this dhalmel lost its footing and fell. As it plunged towards certain death, the fervent desire to live awakened its latent ability to harness the wind, and thus did it soar to safety. This may or may not have happened, but let's say it did. — In-game description

80.name: Diamond Gwiber
80.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Cloud Deck (Extreme) Purchased from C'intana for 99 Diamond Totems.
80.description: “ Summon forth your diamond gwiber, a draconic arcane entity. Believed to have been absorbed into the Diamond Weapon, this plate-clad being answers the call of a horn imbued with the power of an unknown primal, the summoner of whom is believed to have been a member of the Corvosian resistance. — In-game description

81.name: Direwolf
81.acquired_by: Purchased from Ixali Vendor in North Shroud (X:24.9 Y:22.7) for 120,000 gil after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Ixal society.
81.description: “ Summon forth your deadly direwolf, one of five pups found huddling together in the snow near the corpse of their slain mother. Mass cullings of the beasts during the Sixth Astral Era prompted naturalists to deem the species extinct. However, this claim was proved false when Ixali scouts discovered a lone pack roaming the sparsely inhabited mountains of Xelphatol. — In-game description

82.name: Disembodied Head
82.acquired_by: Purchased with 10 Gelmorran Potsherds from E-Una-Kotor in the South Shroud at Quarrymill (x25,y20.6). Gelmorran Potsherds are obtained from Palace of the Dead.
82.description: “ Summon forth your disembodied head. Not your disembodied head. A disembodied head. That's yours. E-Una-Kotor created this winged monstrosity using stone hewn from the very walls of the Palace of the Dead in an attempt to better understand the guardian golems which watch over the Lost City of Amdapor. That the face chosen for the design bears an uncanny likeness to a certain someone is one stone best left unturned. — In-game description

83.name: Dodo
83.acquired_by: Drops from Platinum-haloed Sack ( Heaven-on-High floors 71-100). Drops from Materiel Container 4.0.
83.description: “ Summon forth your noble dodo─hopefully not the last one in existence. For centuries people of the Far East believed the dodo lost─the cloudkin hunted to extinction by poachers who would use its feathers for petticoats and its eggs for cheesy omelettes. The recent discovery of a nest in the upper echelons of Heaven–on–High , however, has given naturalists hope that the species may still endure. — In-game description

84.name: Draught Chocobo
84.acquired_by: Recruit a friend through the Recruit a Friend Campaign. The recruiter will receive the Draught Chocobo after the friend has subscribed for 90 days.
84.description: “ Summon forth your draught chocobo, a massive bird large and strong enough to bear two riders. This heretofore unseen breed of chocobo was said to have been discovered by chocobo hunters searching for the legendary Chocobo Forest . Its enormous size would make it a fine pack chocobo, but its foul temper prevents it from completing even the simplest of tasks without the injury of some poor rider. — In-game description

85.name: Dreadnaught
85.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 20)
85.description: “ Summon forth your dreadnaught, a hulking machina that's equally at home on the battlefield as it is at construction sites. Originally used as a weapon, this Allagan machina was eventually superseded by newer models and repurposed for construction. Legends tell of a young man who took one such unit on a rampage, wreaking havoc through enemy ranks. — In-game description

86.name: Dynamite
86.acquired_by: Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
86.description: “ Summon forth your dynamite, a soulkin favored of the merchant Rowena. House-trained and should therefore not explode in a fiery conflagration. A variety of fiend that is brought to life when an inanimate rock is imbued with aether. Due to the possibility that it harbors precious stones, this specimen was acquired by Rowena and entrusted to the care of Khloe Aliapoh. As a result, it has become so familiar with people that it is willing to carry a rider. — In-game description

87.name: Eden
87.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Eden's Promise: Eternity (Savage)
87.description: “ Summon forth Eden, or rather, a considerably smaller version of the gargantuan entity. The existence of this miniaturized replica can be attributed─as with many, many other things─to a combination of aether and crystal, a fragment of which was discovered inside Eden itself. The result was this smaller likeness, which may be summoned at will and is probably less likely to trigger an apocalyptic catastrophe. — In-game description

88.name: Eggeater
88.acquired_by: Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
88.description: “ Summon forth your eggeater, an anteater raised on a luxurious diet of eggs. Under the patronage of its mistress, Rowena, this widowmaker has led a pampered life. As it was impractical to feed it the prodigious quantities of ants its kind consumes in the wild, however, it was instead raised on a diet of beaten eggs. This specimen is well accustomed to men, and permits those it trusts to ride upon its back. — In-game description

89.name: Eggshilaration System
89.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Eggsistential Crisis during Hatching-tide (2017). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
89.description: “ Call into battle your eggshilaration system. Egg puns required for propulsion. After learning of the latest of the Dreamer's visions─a giant floating ovoid delivering eggs to all the good boys and girls of the realm─Nonotta and friends literally scrambled to find a means of bringing her dream to life. All it required was a little aid from the Sons of Saint Coinach...and the remnants of some ancient Allagan technology. — In-game description

90.name: Ehll Tou
90.acquired_by: Complete the quest On Ehll Tou's Wings which requires Custom Delivery level 5 with Ehll Tou.
90.description: “ Summon forth Ehll Tou, the young dragon with a passion for crafting. First encountered as a curious dragonet, Ehll Tou became a dragon grown during her stay in Ishgard. With her passion for crafting, she underwent an evolution heretofore unseen in her kind, developing dexterous forelimbs that allow her to deftly wield all manner of implements. — In-game description

91.name: Eldthurs
91.acquired_by: Random drop from Gold Coffers in The Forbidden Land, Eureka Pyros. Drops from Materiel Container 4.0. Random drop from a bronze or silver random overworld treasure coffer in The Occult Crescent: South Horn.
91.description: “ Summon forth your Eldthurs, named for a fiery giant who once ruled a realm of flame with his brothers. Despite the imposing name, naturalists believe Eldthursar to be naught but yeti whose ancestors forswore their icy mountain homes, choosing instead the molten lakes of Pyros to raise their young. Though not necessarily known for their obedience, this particular specimen has been trained to accept the orders of a rider without taking a bite out of her thigh. — In-game description

92.name: Emerald Gwiber
92.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Castrum Marinum (Extreme). Purchased from C'intana for 99 Emerald Totems.
92.description: “ Summon forth your emerald gwiber, a draconic arcane entity. Called forth by a mysterious horn infused with the power of an unknown primal absorbed by the Emerald Weapon. Whether it sees through the glowing orb at the front of its snout or some other means is unclear. — In-game description

93.name: Enbarr
93.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Whorleater (Extreme).
93.description: “ Summon forth Enbarr, the legendary steed favored of the primal Leviathan. It is said to have been born of the surging waves. Legend states that the Lord of the Whorl, Leviathan, birthed this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the Sahagin in sacrifice. — In-game description

94.name: Epimetheus
94.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 14)
94.description: “ Summon forth Epimetheus, an unstoppable vehicle of war. Or at least it would be if it were bigger. Garlond Ironworks recreated this warmachina from a blueprint acquired by a Scion operative on a covert mission to Garlemald. As the dimensions were missing from the document, however, its size had to be estimated, the resultant vehicle being rather smaller than the original. — In-game description

95.name: Euphonious Kamuy
95.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Hells' Kier (Extreme). Purchased from Eschina for 99 Suzaku Totems.
95.description: “ Summon your euphonious kamuy, noble wolf blessed by the scarlet auspice Suzaku. Having sacrificed its life to save his master, this magnificent canine was spared the pull of the Lifestream by the auspice Suzaku and her scarlet flames of rebirth. — In-game description

96.name: Eurekan Petrel
96.acquired_by: Random drop from Gold Coffers in The Forbidden Land, Eureka Hydatos. Drops from Materiel Container 4.0. Random drop from a bronze or silver random overworld treasure coffer in The Occult Crescent: South Horn.
96.description: “ Summon your Eurekan petrel, because who hasn't dreamed of gazing down upon all creation from the mantle of a wind-borne gastropod? Of all the species of petrels known to man, the Eurekan petrel is the only one which is not actually a petrel, but, in fact, an oversized carnivorous sea slug. Admittedly, unlike most sea slugs, this unique variety possesses the capacity for extended flight, hence the understandable misnomer. — In-game description

97.name: Fae Gwiber
97.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Dancing Plague (Extreme). Purchased from Fathard for 99 King Totems.
97.description: “ Summon forth your fae gwiber, a draconic arcane entity. Desiring to recreate the fantastical beast known as the dragon, a sorcerer from ages past fashioned a horn imbued with Titania's power. The creature which answers the sound is aglow with fae magicks. — In-game description

98.name: Falcon
98.acquired_by: Fly the Falcon Mount Campaign (July - September, 2017) Moogle Treasure Trove events.
98.description: “ Call into battle the Falcon , (unofficially) the fastest single-rider airship ever built in Eorzea. An independent project of Garlond Ironworks engineer Wedge, this single-rider airship allegedly recorded some of the fastest flight speeds ever...until a tragic accident following an attempt to see how high the ship could soar convinced its creator that perhaps a modicum of restraint was necessary. — In-game description

99.name: Fat Black Chocobo
99.acquired_by: Amazon.com promotion for purchasing $20 of video games (June - July, 2019) Twitch campaign (June - August, 2021) Twitter sweepstakes (August 2023).
99.description: “ Summon forth your fat black chocobo and marvel at its flurry of pitch-dark plumage. According to those familiar with this prodigious poultry's journey from flightless fledgling to full-blown fowl, the cloudkin achieved its staggering girth after several summers of gluttonously gulping chunks of charred chicken. Though, many speculate that the chocobo is, in fact, no chocobo at all, but a heretofore unseen spirit (or demon) of Dravania 's dark wood. — In-game description

100.name: Fat Chocobo
100.acquired_by: Reward for purchasing the Collector's Edition or Digital Collector's Edition of A Realm Reborn. (account-wide)
100.description: “ Summon forth your fat chocobo mount. Take care that there is sufficient room for his ample girth. Playfully described by some as “large and in charge,” in truth, when summoned, this gluttonous gourmand will flap nary a feather unless a garland of gysahl greens is dangled before him─in which case not even the laws of nature can slow the fat chocobo down. — In-game description

101.name: Fat Moogle
101.description: “ Summon forth the fat moogle. How can he fly? Because magic. How can he fly bearing two riders? MAGIC. This plus-sized patrician epitomizes the ancient moogle proverb regarding kupo nuts that says, “Once you kupop, you cannot stop.” Basic laws of physics suggest that wings as small as the fat moogle's should not provide enough lift for true flight...yet here we are. — In-game description

102.name: Fatter Cat
102.description: “ Summon your fatter cat─fatter than a fat cat, obviously. Seeing as how this pursy pussy can defy the very laws of physics by propelling itself high into the firmament, it is very likely that the creature is either a voidsent using a bloated cat's corpse as its corporeal vessel, or a deceased pet reanimated by one well versed in the necromantic arts. — In-game description

103.name: Felyne Support Team Cart
103.acquired_by: Rare drop from The Windward Wilds or The Windward Wilds (Extreme). Purchase from the Smithy in Tuliyollal for 99 Guardian Arkveld Certificate.
103.description: “ Summon forth your Felyne support team cart, safe in the knowledge that there is no reward penalty for riding it. Featuring a time-tested construction, this cart is purpose-built to bear distressed hunters to safety. No matter how dangerous the destination, the Felynes will never fail to sally forth to the rescue, but it appears some hunters would not be caught dead being carted away. — In-game description

104.name: Fenrir
104.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant for 1,000,000 MGP.
104.description: “ Summon forth a purebred Abalathian hoarhound named after its pack's legendary leader. Following the rise of Ishgard, hoarhounds all but disappeared from the Coerthas highlands. However, the shift in climate caused by the Calamity has seen the legendary beasts descend from their mountain dens once more. — In-game description

105.name: Firebird
105.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Sidequest " Fiery Wings, Fiery Hearts" after acquiring the 7 Lanner mounts from Heavensward extreme trials.
105.description: “ Summon forth your Firebird. Not Phoenix. Definitely not Phoenix. The Far East is home to numerous legends concerning birds of flame who sacrifice their lives to save the world, only to rise from the ashes of destruction to rule the skies once again. The Firebird is one of those legends...made a mount. — In-game description

106.name: Flame Warsteed
106.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement A Line in the Sand IV by winning 100 Frontline PvP matches with The Immortal Flames (as the real Grand Company, not the one assigned during the match).
106.description: “ Summon forth your Immortal Flames-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone. After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage during Frontline campaigns. — In-game description

107.name: Flying Chair
107.acquired_by: Crafted by an Alchemist Level 70★★ with Master Alchemist V. Requires 8 Cloudsbreaths, 1 Riviera Armchair. Drops from Materiel Container 4.0.
107.description: “ Summon forth a flying chair to bear you in high style. Featuring elegant lines and designed to minimize waste, this lovingly crafted chair is bound to fly into the hearts of adventurers the world over. No assembly required. — In-game description

108.name: Flying Cumulus
108.acquired_by: Amazon.com promotion for purchasing $20 of video games (April - May, 2017) Twitter sweepstakes (June 2023).
108.description: “ Summon forth the flying cumulus. It is unclear whether its previous owner was a boy with a tail or simply a monkey. There is but one man in all of Hydaelyn who can create such a mystical masterpiece, and it is said he resides upon a misty peak hidden within the mountain ranges of Doma. Crafted by stitching together dozens of smaller clouds, the cumulus allows a single rider to explore the skies...but only if she has an inherent affinity for magicks. — In-game description

109.name: Forgiven Mimicry
109.acquired_by: Purchase from Ose Wyd in Il Mheg for 99 First Light Relic Rare drop from Sack of First Light obtained from Pilgrim's Traverse challenge logs / The Final Verse / The Final Verse (Quantum).
109.description: “ Summon forth your forgiven mimicry. Not actually a sin eater, so it can be ridden without fear of turning those around you into one. Found prowling Pilgrim's Traverse, this motley creature appeared to be a sin eater at first glance, but is in fact a variety of ambulating plant. It is believed that it learned to assume its present form in order to survive in the Light-flooded First. — In-game description

110.name: Forgiven Reticence
110.acquired_by: Purchased from Xylle at The Crystarium or Ilfroy at Eulmore for 3,200 Sack of Nuts.
110.description: “ Summon forth your forgiven reticence. The strong and silent type, so don't expect rousing conversation. Alerted to its presence in the basement of Eulmore, the hunters of Clan Nutsy set out to vanquish this sin eater. Upon seeing that the creature was not aggressive, however, they decided to keep it instead. — In-game description

111.name: Fylgja
111.acquired_by: PvP Series 2 Malmstones - Lvl 25 reward Purchased from Crystal Quartermaster - Wolves' Den Pier for 5,000
111.description: “ Summon forth Fylgja, a dragon with a soft spot for heroes and songs. Like her noble forebear Ratatoskr, Fylgja is passing fond of mankind, and traveled the world in search of mortals worthy of immortalizing in song. During the course of her journeys, she would encounter a soul who shone most brilliantly in battle. So moved was she by the hero's selfless valor, she chose to become  follower. — In-game description

112.name: Gabriel Mark III
112.acquired_by: Dropped in level 80 duty Delubrum Reginae. Random drop from a bronze or silver random overworld treasure coffer in The Occult Crescent: South Horn.
112.description: “ Summon forth your Gabriel Mark III mount, though you may find this transforming warmachina is less than meets the eye. Claims that its gold paint deflects laser beams are entirely unfounded. As any experienced adventurer knows, if a previously bested enemy appears again with a new color scheme, it will pose a significantly greater threat than before, or at least, take longer to kill. Luckily, this miniature prototype is on your side, or so you hope. — In-game description

113.name: Gabriel α
113.acquired_by: Random drop from Southern Front Lockboxes obtained in The Bozjan Southern Front. Random drop from a bronze or silver random overworld treasure coffer in The Occult Crescent: South Horn.
113.description: “ Summon forth your Gabriel α. Magic shield not included. Armaments for decorative purposes only. Prior to building a full-sized prototype of a new transforming armor dubbed Gabriel , project engineers created this scale test model to perform aerodynamic testing. While it passed said tests with flying colors, it was observed that its engine may be prone to running hot. — In-game description

114.name: Garlond GL-II
114.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 24,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
114.description: “ Summon forth your Garlond GL-II. For those who've got a nice place─who never wanted to be anybody else. This prototype magitek vehicle was developed by Garlond Ironworks to be a mode of transportation for a new era. A compact-but-powerful twin-bank ceruleum engine provides effortless acceleration which, coupled with the rugged chassis, allows it to devour rough terrain─such as that one might see on a desert island. — In-game description

115.name: Garlond GL-IIT
115.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 100,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
115.description: “ Summon forth your Garlond GL-IIT, a magitek vehicle equipped with a tiller, and cultivate your isle in style. A variant of the popular Garlond GL-II, this trike has been engineered for cultivating the land. The ceruleum-powered rotary tiller makes short work of transforming rough terrain, while the cargo tray is ideal for transporting materials and passengers both. — In-game description

116.name: Garlond GL-IS
116.description: “ Summon forth your Garlond GL-IS. Fitted with a sidecar to carry a trusty sidekick. A variant of the Garlond GL-I, this magitek vehicle is fitted with a sidecar to allow for two riders, with engine displacement increased to handle the additional weight. Comes with a life-size mascot lovingly crafted by Wedge─but strictly for a limited time only, and while stocks last! — In-game description

117.name: Gilded Magitek Armor
117.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Everybody's Darling by getting 500 Player Commendations.
117.description: “ Call into battle your gilded suit of magitek armor. Its golden coating serves to resist magicks while impressing members of the opposite sex. It only took a few heated skirmishes with the allied city–states for Garlemald to realize that the magicks wielded by the realm's mages were too much for even the thickest of magitek armor plating. Alloyed gilding has since been discovered to dampen the effects of elemental charges and is now standard issue. — In-game description

118.name: Gilded Mikoshi
118.acquired_by: Purchased from Edelina in Mor Dhona (x22,y5) for 50,000,000 gil.
118.description: “ Summon forth your squad of gilded Namazu to bear you upon a gilded mikoshi─all of which is as gaudy as it sounds. In order to secure enough coin to fund their seven-year festival, the Namazu sought the counsel of Rowena, who spoke thus: if you want to make great profit, sell wares of great worth. And what could be worth more than a gilded mikoshi borne by eight gilded Namazu? — In-game description

119.name: Ginga
119.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Frontline Fury by winning 10 Frontline or Rival Wings PvP matches with a GARO title.
119.description: “ Summon forth Ginga. A man-made aberration from a land that exists only in whispers. Its name is said to mean “silver fang.” This otherworldly mount, cobbled together from the carcasses of noble beasts and armored in elaborate silver plate, is said only to accept as riders those who have proven their might and mettle on the fields of battle. — In-game description

120.name: Gloria-class Airship
120.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Blood Born IV by winning 200 matches in The Feast or Crystalline Conflict.
120.description: “ Summon forth the Gloria-class airship. This single-occupancy airship is a singular feat of engineering. Taking inspiration from the half-remembered dream of his grandfather Tatanora, Tataramu used his encyclopedic knowledge to design a small-scale version of a rotary-winged airship. Its name derives from an airship that appears in an obscure novel of unknown origins. — In-game description

121.name: Gobwalker
121.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Alexander - The Burden of the Father (Savage).
121.description: “ Call into battle your gobwalker, a steam-powered war vehicle designed by the infamous Illuminati. Originally designed to be a less-fickle replacement for pack raptors, the gobwalker was quickly reoutfitted into a tool of war after it took twenty goblins to chase down and topple a walker that had gone out of control and destroyed an entire workshop. — In-game description

122.name: Goobbue
122.acquired_by: Reward for people who subscribed to Legacy once fees started.
122.description: “ Use the odd-shaped horn gifted to you by the wandering minstrel to call a massive goobbue to your side. Traded for a song by the High Satrap of a distant land, the secret to taming these creatures once thought to be unbreakable was introduced to Eorzea by a mysterious wandering minstrel who journeyed through the realm in the final days before the Calamity . — In-game description

123.name: Goten
123.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Fame Fatale by winning 30 The Feast or Crystalline Conflict PvP matches with a GARO title.
123.description: “ Summon forth Goten. A man-made aberration from a land that exists only in whispers. Its name is said to mean “roaring heavens.” This otherworldly mount, cobbled together from the carcasses of noble beasts and armored in elaborate gold plate, is said only to accept as riders those who have proven their might and mettle on the fields of battle. — In-game description

124.name: Grani
124.acquired_by: Reward for purchasing the Collector's Edition or Digital Collector's Edition of Shadowbringers. (account-wide)
124.description: “ Summon Grani, heroic steed from a realm not your own. Possessed of a strength of both mind and body that is unmatched in the First, as a mount, Grani has no peer on land nor in the heavens. It is said, however, the noble creature will only accept a rider who has pledged to restore shadow to a land bereft of night. — In-game description

125.name: Great Vessel of Ronka
125.acquired_by: Purchased from Yuqurl Manl in The Rak'tika Greatwood for 18 Qitari Compliments after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Qitari society.
125.description: “ Summon forth the Great Vessel of Ronka. Don't mind the contents. This ancient Ronkan urn was discovered empty save for a peculiar flute, the sound of which caused the vessel to suddenly become thus occupied. “Where did it come from?” the curious may be compelled to inquire, but the wise know better than to question the divine. — In-game description

126.name: Griffin
126.acquired_by: Reward for purchasing the Collector's Edition or Digital Collector's Edition of Heavensward. (account-wide)
126.description: “ Summon forth your griffin─half eagle, half lion, all business. Fantastical winged beasts native to the unscalable peaks of Abalathia's Spine, griffins actually have a long history of serving as mounts. Indeed, before the city–state's fall, the Ala Mhigan army maintained a regiment of griffin–back soldiers who would harry opposing forces. — In-game description

127.name: Gullfaxi
127.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Navel (Extreme).
127.description: “ Summon forth Gullfaxi, the legendary steed favored of the primal Titan. Its powerful legs set off tremors that can be felt from malms away. Legend states that the Lord of Crags, Titan, wrought this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the kobolds in sacrifice. — In-game description

128.name: Gwiber of Light
128.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Seat of Sacrifice (Extreme) Purchased from Fathard for 99 Totems of Light.
128.description: “ Summon forth your gwiber of light, a draconic arcane entity. This light-bathed being answers to the sound of a horn imbued with the power of a hero of eld. In another time and place, perhaps it was the mount of a valiant soul who rose up against evil. Or perhaps not. The truth lies amidst the blinding light. — In-game description

129.name: Hallowed Kamuy
129.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Wreath of Snakes (Extreme) Purchased from Eschina for 99 Seiryu Totems.
129.description: “ Summon your hallowed kamuy, noble wolf blessed by the azure auspice Seiryu. Abandoned by its master, this loyal canine was discovered by the auspice Seiryu and granted a new life in service of the thousand-year-old lord. — In-game description

130.name: High Mobility Vacuum Suit
130.acquired_by: Complete the Out of This World achivement by earning a cosmic class score of 500,000 points as every Disciple of the Hand and Land.
130.description: “ Summon forth your high mobility vacuum suit, and live the dream of piloting a futuristic bipedal machina. Those who have made exceptional contributions to the Cosmic Exploration Initiative are presented with this special vacuum suit, whose chassis and drivetrain have been tuned to increase power output. While proportionately more difficult to maneuver as a result, it is highly regarded among veteran pilots. — In-game description

131.name: Hippo Cart
131.acquired_by: Purchased from Ghanta in Thavnair for 18 Arkasodara Pana after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Arkasodara society.
131.description: “ Summon forth your hippo cart, a mean if not so lean transporting machine. Drawing upon the design of chocobo carriages, a collective of Arkasodara youths invented this two-wheeled hippo-drawn cart. The sunshade cloth incorporates techniques used in crafting Corvosi flying carpets, and grants cart and hippo both the ability to soar the skies. — In-game description

132.name: His Royal Headness on Parade
132.description: “ Summon forth His Royal Headness on Parade, that all may bask in the splendor of a well-formed noggin. This uncanny mascot of a forgotten amusement park has no tolerance for unsightly heads, and will stop at nothing to separate those that fail to satisfy him from their bodies. The only way to escape his scrutiny is to ride him, thereby becoming one with his flawless noggin. — In-game description

133.name: Hovering Hot Pot
133.description: “ Summon forth your hovering hot pot. Formerly a ritual cauldron, it now soars the skies while simmering with scrumptious morsels. Long ago, when a ritual cauldron was accidentally used to cook dinner for the lord of Yanxia, a strange phenomenon occurred which saw the vessel rise into the air like the fiery wheels of divine legend. Thereafter, subsequent generations of rulers took to filling the cauldron with various delicacies, which they enjoyed even as they hovered in the heavens. — In-game description

134.name: Hybodus
134.acquired_by: Complete the achievement No More Fish in the Sea II by scoring at least 10,000 points during a single ocean fishing voyage.
134.description: “ Summon forth your hybodus to ride the winds and menace the skies. A close relative of the tornado shark, this fearsome fish soars the skies by means of an organ that allows it to manipulate wind-aspected aether. The four fins protruding from its head are used to deftly control its course in flight. — In-game description

135.name: Incitatus
135.acquired_by: Purchased from Khloe Aliapoh for 1 Khloe's Gold Certificate of Commendation Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
135.description: “ Summon forth Incitatus, an enchanted steed favored of the merchant Rowena. If it could talk, it would doubtless drive a hard bargain. Under the patronage of its mistress, Rowena, this enchanted steed has led a pampered life. Able to comprehend language, it was often seen attending Khloe Aliapoh's storytelling sessions, her tales of high adventure inspiring it to set out on one of its own. — In-game description

136.name: Indigo Whale
136.description: “ Summon forth a massive whale straight from the Indigo Deep. If only you could do this with fish as well. Pods of these massive wavekin are believed to traverse the Indigo Deep for thousands of malms in pursuit of food. Why they would choose to limit themselves to the confines of the sea despite possessing the capacity for aether-assisted flight is a mystery scholars have pondered for centuries. — In-game description

137.name: Innocent Gwiber
137.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Crown of the Immaculate (Extreme). Purchased from Fathard for 99 Immaculate Totems.
137.description: “ Summon forth your innocent gwiber, a draconic arcane entity. Answering to a horn imbued with the almighty Innocence's power, this draconic arcane entity is enveloped in the selfsame glow as the Lightwarden whence it takes its name. Rest assured it is not a sin eater. — In-game description

138.name: Interstellar Dhalmel
138.acquired_by: Purchase from Mesouaidonque in any Cosmic Exploration zone for 29,000.
138.description: “ Summon forth your interstellar dhalmel, and ride it boldly where no dhalmel has gone before. This dhalmel was a subject in adaptability testing for life-forms native to Etheirys. As their kind is found in multifarious lands, from arid wastes to floating isles, they are believed to be highly adaptable, and it is hoped that they will also thrive in interstellar environments. — In-game description

139.name: Ironfrog Mover
139.acquired_by: Purchased from Fathard for 12 Formidable Cogs from the FATE A Finale Most Formidable.
139.description: “ Summon forth your ironfrog mover, a dwarven-made automaton. Dwarven artisans have reinforced this automaton to improve lower body durability as well as installed a propulsion unit to enable flight. The techniques employed in its creation are a jealously guarded secret, and a blight upon the beards of they who betray it. — In-game description

140.name: Island Adenium
140.acquired_by: Randomly drops from Sanctuary Materiel Container. Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 200 Vegetal Voucher.
140.description: “ Summon forth your island adenium. Literally a desert rose by another name, and doesn't have much of a scent to brag about. Sprouted and grown in the South Mandra Kingdom, this adenium lived what he thought was a happy life until he encountered the Peerifool. From the castaway vegetable, he learned about the great wide world beyond the island's bounds, and began to dream of embarking upon grand adventures. — In-game description

141.name: Island Alligator
141.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 35,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
141.description: “ Summon forth your island alligator. Demands to be seen not later, but always. Hailing from unknown shores, this alligator appeared on your island one day and made itself at home. It takes pride in the fact that its kind is rare out at sea, and willingly carries a rider upon its back if only so it can parade itself in front of all and sundry. — In-game description

142.name: Island Buffalo
142.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 50,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
142.description: “ Belonging to a species introduced by pirates as livestock, this mild-mannered beast took to living on your island one day. Though it appears to have reverted to being feral, it is easily won over with food, in gratitude for which it happily bears you upon its back. — In-game description

143.name: Island Eggplant Knight
143.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 12,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
143.description: “ Summon forth your island Eggplant Knight, an oversized vegetable embodiment of chivalry. Hailing from the selfsame land as the Tomato King, the Eggplant Knight shared a crate with the sovereign when they were shipped out. However, he fell overboard when the vessel encountered rough seas, and drifted for days before being deposited on a desert island. Among other feats, he prides himself on having played a key role in the founding of the West Mandra Empire. — In-game description

144.name: Island Garlic Jester
144.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 18,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
144.description: “ Summon forth your island Garlic Jester, a mandragora as pungent as it is humorous. Possessed of a humorous wit, this mandragora encountered the island Tomato King when they were both adrift. During that time, he amused his sovereign with dozens of droll tales, and in recognition for his services, he was appointed the court jester after the founding of the West Mandra Empire. — In-game description

145.name: Island Mandragora
145.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 12,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
145.description: “ Summon forth your island mandragora, a prime piece of island produce. Born into an influential family in the West Mandra Empire, fabled nation of vegetables, this mandragora grew to its prodigious size thanks to fertile soil and abundant sunlight. Alas, its blessed upbringing could also be considered a curse, for it is the fate of such prime produce to go to market. — In-game description

146.name: Island Mandragora Queen
146.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 18,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
146.description: “ Summon forth your island Mandragora Queen, a well-cultivated vegetable fit for a king. The life of this island-grown princess was forever changed when she met her future husband the island Tomato King, whom the tides had borne to her. Overcoming their difference in origin, they wed and unified the island's vegetables under the banner of the West Mandra Empire. — In-game description

147.name: Island Onion Prince
147.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 12,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
