147.description: “ Summon forth your island Onion Prince, a vegetable whose colossal size befits his station. Royalty among mandragora, this island-bred Onion Prince knew every comfort growing up. Such a pampered life led to boredom, however, and he took to whiling away the days in mischief. Dismayed by his son's behavior, the king sent him off to squire for a renowned hero, that he might learn something of responsibility and leadership. — In-game description

148.name: Island Peerifool
148.acquired_by: Randomly drops from Sanctuary Materiel Container
148.description: “ Summon forth your island Peerifool. If anyone asks, it bears no relation whatsoever to a certain malicious rotting vegetable. Loaded aboard a trading vessel as part of its provisions, this mandragora decided to try her luck in the open sea rather than be added to soup. As luck would have it, the tides delivered her to a desert island, whose fertile soil and sunshine allowed her to attain enormous proportions. — In-game description

149.name: Island Tomato King
149.acquired_by: Purchased from Horrendous Hoarder in Unnamed Island (12.6, 28.3) for 18,000 Seafarer's Cowrie.
149.description: “ Summon forth your island Tomato King, a sovereign who rules with a strong and juicy─er, just hand. Grown in sunny Vylbrand, this king among produce was being shipped to distant lands when his crate was cast overboard in rough seas. He eventually arrived at a desert island, where he triumphed in a war with avaricious avians and won the heart of a local princess, together with whom he established the West Mandra Empire. — In-game description

150.name: Ixion
150.acquired_by: Purchased from Eschina for 12 Ixion Horns from the FATE A Horse Outside. Purchased from Khloe Aliapoh for 1 Khloe's Silver Certificate of Commendation. Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 300 Faux Leaf
150.description: “ Summon forth mighty Ixion, legend of the Gyr Abanian highlands. Ask any Gyr Abanian youth, and she will tell you the story of Ixion, Rhalgr's steed─swift as a levinbolt and strong as thunderclap. However, the discovery of several ancient Mhachi texts suggests that the creature may simply be a stallion augmented by ancient technologies that have granted it life eternal...and the ability to shoot lightning from its eyes. — In-game description

151.name: Jibanyan Couch
151.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement More Inventory Slots, Please II by obtaining all 17 Yo-kai Weapons during the Collaboration Event Yo-kai Watch: Gather One, Gather All!.
151.description: “ Summon forth the Jibanyan couch. A mysterious piece of furniture designed in the likeness of a Yo-kai named Jibanyan. Despite being modeled upon Jibanyan, an Earthbound Yo-kai, this couch is able to fly. It is said to be so comfortable as to turn men and Yo-Kai alike into useless layabouts. — In-game description

152.name: Juedi
152.acquired_by: Speak with the Cast-off Confederate with all 4 Empyrean Accessories from Heaven-on-High in your inventory.
152.description: “ Summon Juedi, and jump straight to ludicrous speed. Its ancient Doman name loosely translating to “ludicrously swift steed that runs so fast its feet no longer touch the ground,” Juedi is yet another horse of legend, showered with geomantic magicks to grant the creature the gift of flight. — In-game description

153.name: Kamuy of the Nine Tails
153.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Sidequest A Lone Wolf No More after acquiring the 7 Kamuy mounts from Stormblood extreme trials.
153.description: “ Summon Kamuy of the Nine Tails, legendary auspice, completely independent from Kyubi of the Nine Tails. Only an individual who has proven his worth by taming no less than seven kamuy might summon this fabled vulpine auspice from her burrow in the heavens. Despite obvious similarities to the other vulpine auspice, Kyubi of the Nine Tails, this ageless vixen has her own storied history...which is, sadly, too long to list here. — In-game description

154.name: Kingly Peacock
154.description: “ Summon forth your kingly peacock, an avian embodiment of nobility hailing from Othard. From the Near East to the Far, the peacock has long been esteemed not only for its beauty, but also its penchant for eating harmful vilekin. This particular creature belongs to a breed created by improving a species indigenous to Othard with geomancy. — In-game description

155.name: Kirin
155.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Sidequest " A Legend for a Legend" after acquiring the 6 Nightmare Mounts (excluding the one called "Nightmare") from A Realm Reborn extreme trials.
155.description: “ Summon forth Kirin, Far Eastern king of the beasts. Ask any man in Othard who rules the realm of beasts, and you will receive the same answer─Kirin. It is believed that the lionlike creature has walked the eastern lands for over a thousand years and will only answer the call of a hero it has deemed worthy. — In-game description

156.name: Kongamato
156.acquired_by: Purchased from Vath Stickpeddler in The Dravanian Forelands for 200,000 gil after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Vath society.
156.description: “ Summon forth your kongamato, raised with care by the Vath stickpeddler. After hatching from an egg laid near the riverbanks, the kongamato larva spends its early life as a water-dwelling insect. Its maturity is signified by metamorphosis, during which its wings sprout forth and it takes to the skies. — In-game description

157.name: Korpokkur Kolossus
157.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant for 750,000 MGP
157.description: “ Summon forth your korpokkur kolossus, a veritable colossus among its kind. In search of an ideal home, this korpokkur journeyed long malms before finally coming to a stop at the Gold Saucer. The trek across the scorching Sagolii had reduced it to a withered husk, but when next it drank, it experienced what could only be described as an epic rebound. — In-game description

158.name: Landerwaffe
158.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Sidequest " The Dragon Made" after acquiring the 7 Gwiber mounts from Shadowbringers extreme trials.
158.description: “ Summon forth Landerwaffe, magnificent mechanical dragon of legend, and be the envy of all the other kids. Armed literally to the wings, this mechanical dragon is believed to have been created by the Allagan Empire to combat the creatures whose form it mimics. Magnificent and proud, it allows none upon its back save one whom it deems a true hero. — In-game description

159.name: Laurel Goobbue
159.acquired_by: Purchased from Sylphic Vendor in East Shroud for 120,000 gil after achieving Rank 4 (Trusted) reputation with the Sylph society.
159.description: “ Summon your laurel goobbue, towering friend to the sylphs. After having the moss and flowers growing upon his head pulled up and tossed aside like common weeds by a band of sylvan ne'er-do-wells, this quiet-mannered goobbue was taken in and cared for by the sylphs of Little Solace whose elders crafted for him a magnificent laurel with which to hide his scars. — In-game description

160.name: Legacy Chocobo
160.acquired_by: The Legacy Campaign, a loyalty reward available to players who stuck with 1.x during the rough periods and subscribed to the game for at least 90 days.
160.description: “ Five years and a realm-shaking Calamity were not enough to break the bonds between you and your loyal steed. A single whistle and he will be at your side once again. In the five years following your sudden disappearance from the Carteneau Flats, your ever-faithful chocobo spent each waking moment galloping across the realm in search of his lost master. His myriad adventures are nothing less than fantastical and heartbreaking...but that is a story for another day. — In-game description

161.name: Legendary Kamuy
161.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Shinryu's Domain. Purchased from Eschina for 99 Shinryu Totems.
161.description: “ Summon forth the legendary kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics. Perpetually enveloped in a divine glow, it is said to have been born when an Ala Mhigan war hound chanced to bathe in Shinryu's light in the moment of the primal's birth. — In-game description

162.name: Level Checker
162.acquired_by: Purchased from Nesvaaz in Radz-at-Han (x11,y10) for 12 Chi Bolt from the FATE Omicron Recall: Killing Order
162.description: “ Summon forth your level checker, a mysterious machine that can determine your strength...and apparently also shrink and carry you inside it. When this mysterious machine first determined your strength, the result was “level 90.” By what method it came up with its figure, and whether it is even accurate, none can possibly say. — In-game description

163.name: Logistics Node
163.acquired_by: PvP Series 3 Malmstones - Lvl 15 reward Purchased from Crystal Quartermaster - Wolves' Den Pier for 5,000
163.description: “ Call into battle your Allagan logistics node. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled. One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to oversee logistics in their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere was off-loaded to the Eorzean Alliance and modified into a personal transportation device. — In-game description

164.name: Logistics System
164.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Behind Enemy Lines I by winning 200 Frontline PvP matches with any Grand Company.
164.description: “ Call into battle your Allagan logistics system. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled. One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to maintain and protect their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere was modified by Nero tol Scaeva into a personal transportation device. — In-game description

165.name: Lone Faehound
165.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 4).
165.description: “ Summon forth your lone faehound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours. Covered from muzzle to tail in an otherworldly silver coat, the faehound appears more akin to something out of a faerie tale than from the nether-reaches of the void. Yet do not be fooled by the beast's appearance, for he is an equal in strength to all but the highest ranking voidsent, his heart swollen with savagery from a lifetime hunting alone. — In-game description

166.name: Lone Hellhound
166.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 3).
166.description: “ Summon forth your lone hellhound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours. Having survived, alone, the hellish darkness that is the void, this demonic beast will not soon suffer the presence of others, choosing typically to attack before he himself becomes a victim. Which is why it is all the more surprising that the hound would allow someone on his back. — In-game description

167.name: Lowrider T1RANT
167.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of AAC Heavyweight M4 (Savage)
167.description: “ Call into battle your Lowrider T1RANT, and rule the roads with an iron fist (around the custom leather-bound steering wheel). This vintage vehicle manufactured in Lindblum once belonged to the president of the Arcadion, who had inherited it from his forebears. It was comprehensively modified with cutting-edge technology for the Tyrant's use, and boasts enhanced flight capabilities as well as the latest comforts, the better to lord it over the peasants. — In-game description

168.name: Lunar Kamuy
168.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Tsukuyomi's Pain. Purchased from Eschina for 99 Lunar Totems.
168.description: “ Summon forth the lunar kamuy, noble wolf blessed by the Lady of the Moon. When a wild wolf living in an abandoned imperial stronghold is bathed in the aether of a goddess reborn, amazing results are to be expected. — In-game description

169.name: Lunar Whale
169.description: “ Summon forth the Lunar Whale, which is definitely not an actual whale, but certainly large enough to warrant the name. Seats up to eight people, including the pilot. Produced by Garlond Ironworks based on mysterious tales from a distant land, it not only resembles a whale on the outside, but shares its voluminous belly. With enough room for the pilot and seven passengers, it stands─or rather, floats─in a class of its own. — In-game description

170.name: Lynx of Abyssal Grief
170.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Abyssal Fracture (Extreme).
170.description: “ Summon forth your lynx of abyssal grief, which could be what a certain dread voidsent born in the depths of the moon might look like as a large, winged feline. A phantom creation whose being brims with the Darkness that roiled in the depths of the Thirteenth's moon. The motes of Light it sheds calls to mind the yearning for home that drove the dread voidsent Zeromus, but the origins of this familiar are shrouded in abyssal grief. — In-game description

171.name: Lynx of Divine Light
171.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Hydaelyn's Call. Purchased from Nesvaaz for 99 Umbral Totems.
171.description: “ Summon forth your lynx of divine light, which could be what a certain will of the star might look like as a large, winged feline. A phantom creation whose elemental aspect is tipped strongly towards the umbral. Its radiant wings call to mind the majesty of Hydaelyn, the will and protector of the star, but the origins of this familiar are shrouded in divine Light. — In-game description

172.name: Lynx of Eternal Darkness
172.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Zodiark's Fall Purchased from Nesvaaz for 99 Astral Totems.
172.description: “ Summon forth your lynx of eternal darkness, which could be what a certain eldest of all primals might look like as a large, winged feline. A phantom creation whose elemental aspect is tipped strongly towards the astral. Its shadowed wings call to mind the valiance of Zodiark, eldest and mightiest of primals, but the origins of this familiar are shrouded in eternal Darkness. — In-game description

173.name: Lynx of Fallen Shadow
173.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Voidcast Dais (Extreme). Purchased from Nesvaaz for 99 Voidcast Archfiend Totems.
173.description: “ Summon forth your lynx of fallen shadow, which is what a certain knight in black might look like as a large, winged feline. A phantom creation whose elemental aspect is tipped strongly towards Darkness. The motes of Light it sheds call to mind the grim resolve of one who bears a great burden, but the origins of this familiar are shrouded in fallen shadow. — In-game description

174.name: Lynx of Imperious Wind
174.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Storm's Crown (Extreme). Purchased from Nesvaaz for 99 Windswept Archfiend Totems.
174.description: “ Summon forth your lynx of imperious wind, which could be what a certain tempestuous archfiend might look like as a large, winged feline. A phantom creation whose elemental aspect is tipped strongly towards astral wind. Its blustery wings call to mind the caprice of Barbariccia, archfiend of wind, but the origins of this familiar are shrouded in unrelenting storms. — In-game description

175.name: Lynx of Righteous Fire
175.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Mount Ordeals (Extreme). Purchased from Nesvaaz for 99 Flamecloaked Archfiend Totems.
175.description: “ Summon forth your lynx of righteous fire, which could be what a certain honor-bound archfiend might look like as a large, winged feline. A phantom creation whose elemental aspect is tipped strongly towards astral fire. Its fiery body calls to mind the ardor of Rubicante, archfiend of fire, but the origins of this familiar are shrouded in impenetrable flames. — In-game description

176.name: Magicked Bed
176.acquired_by: Crafted by a Carpenter Level 80★ with Master Carpenter VII. Requires 3 Enchanted Elm Lumbers, 4 Undyed Velveteens and 4 Cloudsbreaths.
176.description: “ Summon forth your magicked bed, and dream a little dream of never needing to get up. Once upon a time, in the Kingdom of Voeburt, there lived a member of the royal family slothful of body but quick of mind. This man desired naught more than to never be parted from his pillow, and so commissioned a bed that could fly...only to swiftly take to the sky without paying for it. He, presumably, lived happily ever after. — In-game description

177.name: Magicked Card
177.acquired_by: Complete the quest The Adventurer with All the Cards after collecting all Triple Triad Cards numbered 1 through 312.
177.description: “ Summon forth your magicked card to take you wonder by wonder, over, sideways, and under. Crafted by Eorzea's foremost goldsmith, Godbert Manderville, this enchanted card is awarded to those who have collected an unprecedented number of Triple Triad cards. May it bear you through endless diamond skies, to dazzling places you never knew, and show you new fantastic points of view. — In-game description

178.name: Magicked Carpet
178.description: “ Summon forth your magicked carpet. Fantasy will set you free. Finally. It is said an ancient king of Corvos , upon conquering a tribe of faeries, bid the faerie queen weave her magicks to forge an object the likes mankind had never seen. The queen was executed shortly after presenting the king with a flying carpet. This is not that carpet, but at least no one was slain in its creation. — In-game description

179.name: Magicked Children's Bed
179.acquired_by: Purchased from Khloe Aliapoh for 1 Khloe's Gold Certificate of Commendation Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
179.description: “ Summon forth your magicked children's bed, and enjoy the carefree sleep of a child wherever you go. Crafted especially for children, this magicked bed hovers by virtue of crystals sourced from floating isles, and gives the sensation of sleeping on a cloud. The design is said to be directly inspired by the beds used at Menphina's Arms. — In-game description

180.name: Magicked Parasol
180.description: “ Summon forth your magicked parasol, and have the whole world at your feet. This flying parasol was created by a certain elderly mage in her youth. Intending to sell them en masse to fund her research, she chose a pink parasol─popular in those days─as the base. Due to the need for considerable magical power and grip strength to use them, however, she experienced only modest success. — In-game description

181.name: Magicked Umbrella
181.description: “ Summon forth your magicked umbrella to whisk you off your feet in the most delightful way. This flying umbrella was created by a certain elderly mage in her youth. It uses a black umbrella as the base, the better for blending into the night and sneaking into the Great Gubal Library from above. Its creator, it would seem, has always had a rebellious streak. — In-game description

182.name: Magitek Armor
182.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Main Scenario Quest The Ultimate Weapon.
182.description: “ Call into battle your suit of Garlond Ironworks-modified magitek armor. This suit of Garlean-developed reaper-class magitek battle armor has had its original control systems purged and replaced with a new, modified core built by Cid of the Garlond Ironworks. — In-game description

183.name: Magitek Avenger
183.acquired_by: Awarded from the achievement Die Another Day III by winning 100 Rival Wings PvP matches.
183.description: “ Call into battle your magitek avenger, an imperial warmachina made mightier by goblin hands. The goblins have carried out extensive work on this magitek avenger, among other things changing it from an autonomous killing machine to one requiring a pilot. After all, there's no substituting the satisfaction of dealing vengeance with one's own hands. Sort of. — In-game description

184.name: Magitek Avenger A1
184.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Out of Hiding by winning 100 Rival Wings PvP matches on Hidden Gorge.
184.description: “ Call into battle your magitek avenger A1─outfitted and optimized for alpine warfare. Proving once again there is naught a Garlean engineer can do that a goblin cannot do better, this magitek avenger, nicknamed the “Yeti,” has been repurposed with several layers of self-insulating exoplating, which draw on the ceruleum engine's residual heat to keep the rider warm even in the coldest of climes. — In-game description

185.name: Magitek Avenger G1
185.acquired_by: Purchased from Edelina in Mor Dhona (x22,y5) for 50,000,000 gil.
185.description: “ Call into battle your magitek avenger G1, an imperial warmachina made gaudier by goblin hands. Rumor holds that a golden sasquatch statue stands at the heart of the Garlean capital, from which magitek weapons would emerge to defend the city should it fall under attack. The veracity of the tale aside, the goblins liked it enough that they decided to create this golden avenger to match the statue. — In-game description

186.name: Magitek Conveyor
186.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 7)
186.description: “ Call into battle your magitek conveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics. It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so for the past twenty summers, imperial magitek engineers have been perfecting the art of aerial transport. Surprisingly, it is not outfitted with an active weapons system─clearly an oversight that will be amended in the next model. — In-game description

187.name: Magitek Death Claw
187.acquired_by: Purchased from Jonathas in Old Gridania for 6 Achievement Certificates.
187.description: “ Call into battle your magitek death claw, an imperial warmachina based on ancient Allagan technology. Ancient Allagan weaponry known as an “iron claw” is believed to be the inspiration for this deadly example of imperial ingenuity. While most of the death claws deployed in battle are used for logistical purposes, this particular model has been customized by stationarii units for enemy capture. — In-game description

188.name: Magitek Hyperconveyor
188.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 16).
188.description: “ Call into battle your magitek hyperconveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics. Guided as ever by the ethos of constant advancement, imperial magitek engineers returned to improve their conveyor system, simplifying its assembly and trimming weight by 8%. The result is enhanced fuel efficiency, demonstrating that even world-conquering empires can be environmentally minded. — In-game description

189.name: Magitek Predator
189.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Ala Mhigo.
189.description: “ Call into battle your magitek predator, and have you some fun. Predator series warmachina were originally designed to improve magitek reaper killing potential via the addition of close-quarter weaponry. While the extra firepower led to a higher kill ratio, the weight it added hampered maneuverability. This unique model appears to have had its weapons removed and replaced with an experimental propulsion engine. — In-game description

190.name: Magitek Sky Armor
190.acquired_by: Purchased from the Mark Quartermaster in The Wolves' Den for 20,000 Wolf Marks.
190.description: “ Call into battle your magitek sky armor, state-of-the-art Garlean flight technology at an affordable price. After engine failure saw this single-seated warmachina abandoned on the field of battle, it was salvaged by members of the Eorzean Alliance who had the device sent to the Garlond Ironworks for research and repair. — In-game description

191.name: Magitek Slasher
191.description: “ Call into battle your magitek slasher. Has been stripped of its blades and is therefore safe to ride. An autonomous imperial warmachina designed in the likeness of a vilekin; the razor-sharp blades fitted onto their forelimbs are said to haunt the dreams of many an enemy soldier. This particular unit was seized by the Eorzean Alliance, and subsequently disarmed for use in transportation. — In-game description

192.name: Magna Roader
192.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 11).
192.description: “ Call into battle your magna roader and try not to think too hard on why it is called such. Following their discovery of an imperial roader abandoned in Gyr Abania , several clever goblins came up with the ingenious plan to refurbish the damaged warmachina. The auto-pilot systems, however, were beyond repair, so the engineers were forced to compromise by adding a mannable cockpit. — In-game description

193.name: Manacutter
193.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Main Scenario Quest Into the Aery.
193.description: “ Call into battle your manacutter, a single-rider airship constructed at the Garlond Ironworks. Supervised (in spirit) by the ever-absent Cid, Biggs and Wedge (with a little bending over by Biggs) put their heads together to create this flight-ready miniature airship, powered by the realm's first corrupted crystal engine. — In-game description

194.name: Managarm
194.acquired_by: Purchased from any Calamity Salvager for 8 Gold Chocobo Feathers. Gold Chocobo Feathers can be obtained through the Recruit a Friend campaign, or through World Population Balancing Incentives.
194.description: “ Summon forth Managarm, a legendary hound said to dwell in the hidden depths of Abalathia's Spine. Some say that Managarm is merely a myth. Others believe it to be an extinct beast. Both are wrong, as you well know. According to Abalathian legend, this fearsome hound roams the celestial sphere in pursuit of the moon, whose light it relishes─or so it may appear to those who witness it soaring the skies, spawning spectral flames. — In-game description

195.name: Marid
195.acquired_by: Purchased from Madhura in Gyr Abania for 18 Ananta Dreamstaff after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Ananta society.
195.description: “ Summon forth your marid, trained by the Ananta and outfitted with a magicked carpet allowing for flight. There was once a time when if someone told you they witnessed a marid aloft, you could have had them committed to a sanatorium. Now, marids crisscross the skies thanks, in part, to magicked carpets which the Ananta affix to the backs of beasts they train for battle. — In-game description

196.name: Markab
196.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Striking Tree (Extreme)
196.description: “ Summon forth Markab, the legendary steed favored of the primal Ramuh. It is said to have been born of a single thunderbolt. Legend states that the Lord of Levin, Ramuh, drew forth this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the sylphs in sacrifice. — In-game description

197.name: Maxima Roader
197.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 12).
197.description: “ Call into battle your maxima roader─many times mightier than the mightiest of magna roaders. Following their discovery of an imperial roader abandoned in Gyr Abania , several clever goblins came up with the ingenious plan to not only refurbish the damaged warmachina, but to improve upon its design by adding cermet alloy exoplating and reorganizing synthetic musculature. — In-game description

198.name: Mechanical Lotus
198.description: “ Summon forth your mechanical lotus, a flower-shaped mode of transport with a spiritual aura. Fashioned by the enigmatic Onishishu, this mechanical conveyance assumes the form of the lotus flower, a symbol of purity and sacredness in the East. Indeed, it gives off a distinctly spiritual aura, though how it does so is a jealously guarded secret. — In-game description

199.name: Megaloambystoma
199.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Anabaseios: The Twelfth Circle (Savage).
199.description: “ Summon forth your megaloambystoma. Or should that be max olotl? You decide. The fact that this impossibly large ambystoma is fitted with an elaborate saddle strongly suggests it was created to be ridden. However, its presence in Pandæmonium means it was flawed in some way and deemed a failure. — In-game description

200.name: Megalotragus
200.acquired_by: Purchased from Enie in The Firmament for 8,400 Skybuilders' Scrips.
200.description: “ Summon forth your megalotragus, a herbivore so intimidating it puts carnivores to shame. Preferring colder climes, this imposing herbivore left its original habitat in Abalathia's Spine and migrated to Coerthas , which had frozen over in the Calamity's wake. Its kind are a primitive species that has largely remained unchanged over time, with some known to awaken to magical powers. — In-game description

201.name: Megashiba
201.description: “ Summon forth your megashiba mount─fluffy, living proof that massive can still be adorable. Sold as a “mameshiba,” a nonexistent miniature Far Eastern dog, this creature continued to grow until it was larger than a man. But despite its prodigious size, it has somehow retained its cuteness, which it combines with the practicality of being ridable. — In-game description

202.name: Mehwapyarra
202.acquired_by: Purchased from Uah'shepya in Solution Nine (X:8.6, Y:13.5) for 12 Ttokrrone Scales from the FATE The Serpentlord Seethes.
202.description: “ This fully grown mehwapyarra (“capybara” in certain other parts) was wandering alone in Shaaloani when it was attacked and swallowed whole by the tural vidraal Ttokrrone. Fortunately for the creature, you appeared and put down its devourer before it could be digested, and it now lends you its back out of a sense of duty. — In-game description

203.name: Menoetius
203.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 15).
203.description: “ Summon forth Menoetius. Just like Epimetheus, but more comfortable. Following their successful recreation of Epimetheus, Garlond Ironworks set out to refine the vehicle's design. Their efforts resulted in Menoetius, a model which retains its predecessor's speed while boasting improved comfort and manufacturability. — In-game description

204.name: Midgardsormr
204.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Main Scenario Quest Fetters of Lament.
204.description: “ Summon forth Midgardsormr, the slightly bigger one, but still not the big one. Only after proving your bravery in the face of countless perils has the Father of Dragons found you to be a worthy heir to the Light, and granted you a place upon his back. — In-game description

205.name: Mikoshi
205.acquired_by: Purchased from Gyosho in The Azim Steppe for 20 Namazu Koban after achieving Rank 8 (Bloodsworn) reputation with the Namazu society.
205.description: “ Summon your team of Namazu bearers, carrying a garish mikoshi upon which to precariously perch as they waddle to your destination. Due to excessive zeal on the part of Gyoshin, this mikoshi was crafted with more cloudsbreath than is necessary or, indeed, safe. Thus, it not only floats atop the shoulders of its bearers, it soars aloft regardless of their presence─though that does not discourage them from clinging to its poles anyway. — In-game description

206.name: Miw Miisv
206.acquired_by: Purchased from N-0598 in Ultima Thule for 18 Omicron Omnitoken upon reaching Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Omicron society.
206.description: “ Summon forth Miw Miisv, living proof that hope springs eternal─and in unexpected shapes. Born at Elysion from the hopes of the Ea, this peculiar dynamis life-form possesses a semi-transparent body reminiscent of a jellyfish, and can deliver a sting of sorts with the lightning it harbors. There is no greater pleasure for it than to connect with others in the microcosm of its heart. Literally. — In-game description

207.name: Model O
207.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Alphascape V4.0 (Savage).
207.description: “ Call into battle your Model O, autonomous aerial transport device constructed in Omega's interdimensional manufactory. Thought it is difficult to fathom why Omega would require a weaponless flying mount designed to comfortably accommodate a denizen of Hydaelyn , Garlond Ironworks engineers posit the construct was fabricated in an attempt to better understand its enemies. — In-game description

208.name: Monowheel S1
208.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of AAC Light-heavyweight M4 (Savage).
208.description: “ Summon forth your monowheel S1, a bold vehicle fit for a champion of the Arcadion. A prize Ascension Arcadia bestows upon its champions, this unique one-wheeled vehicle employs an advanced stability system that allows it to traverse any and all terrain. Owing to its complex controls, however, it takes considerable practice to become a competent rider. — In-game description

209.name: Moon-hopper
209.acquired_by: Purchased from Coiningway in Mare Lamentorum for 18 Loporrit Carat upon achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Loporrit society.
209.description: “ Summon forth the moon-hopper. Guaranteed to instill a sense of well-being within all those in earshot. This enhanced version of the supporter was lovingly created by the ever-innovative Inventingway. Not satisfied with merely making it ridable, the Loporrit also fitted a compact speaker that can belt out Dreamingway's feel-good sounds. — In-game description

210.name: Morbol
210.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement True Blue. The achievement is acquired by getting the Achievements Blue Unchained and Masked Conqueror by clearing The Binding Coil of Bahamut - Turn 5, The Second Coil of Bahamut - Turn 4, The Final Coil of Bahamut - Turn 4, Alexander - The Burden of the Father (Savage), Alexander - The Burden of the Son (Savage), and Alexander - The Soul of the Creator (Savage) with a synced full party of Blue Mages without the use of The Echo.
210.description: “ Summon forth your morbol. Strong vines, soft heart...middling stench. Though all it has ever wanted is to help, this morbol was found to be “too sweet” to present a challenge at the Celestium, and was transferred to the Blue Mages' Guild before it had even seen its first match─only for it to be deemed “insufficiently vile” there as well. — In-game description

211.name: Mountain Zu
211.acquired_by: Mountain Dew Gaming promotion for redeeming 3-6 marked bottles (May 16 - July 14, 2024 in North America).
211.description: “ This subspecies of the monstrous zu is known to inhabit the mountainous regions of the Near East. Seeking to tame the ill-tempered bird, Hannish alchemists fed it a specially concocted brew, which had the desired effect while causing the creature to give off a refreshing citrus aroma. — In-game description

212.name: Mystic Panda
212.description: “ Summon forth your mystic panda. From Doma. From a thousand years ago. Armed with the unexplainable ability to levitate...and little else, this thousand-year-old creature (age unconfirmed) has descended the ancient peaks of the Othardian Fanged Crescent in search of a hero to help Doma wrench free from the iron clutches of the Garlean Empire. — In-game description

213.name: Nezha Chariot
213.description: “ Summon forth your Nezha chariot and travel the skies like a god. Yanxian legend tells of a chariot that would carry gods and heroes across the heavens that they might keep watch over their earthbound children. Surprisingly, the realm's flora and fauna are unscathed by the fire and wind belched forth by the divine carriage. — In-game description

214.name: Nightmare
214.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Howling Eye (Extreme), The Navel (Extreme) or The Bowl of Embers (Extreme).
214.description: “ Summon forth the single-horned steed with a temperament as black as his coat. While it is no secret that it was the enigmatic Ascians who provided the beast tribes with nightmares, their reasons for doing so remain shrouded in mystery. Otherwise untamable, the single piercing tone of a magicked whistle is the only method known to soothe the savage beasts. — In-game description

215.name: Oppressor
215.description: “ Originally an autonomous weapon developed by the Illuminati, this oppressor underwent a conversion to be able to carry a pilot. While the process necessitated the stripping of munitions, what the machina loses in destructive capabilities, it gains in luxury and comfort. — In-game description

216.name: Original Fat Chocobo
216.acquired_by: Amazon.com promotion for purchasing $20 of video games (June - July, 2016) Twitter sweepstakes (May 2023).
216.description: “ Summon forth the original fat chocobo. Of course, being the original, it can eat much more than its peers. Maybe not larger, but definitely more in charge, this most gluttonous of gluttons inspired the others to great weights. Although most modern chocobos have yellow plumage, historic tomes portray birds covered in feathers whiter than the whitest snowfall─ All the better to see the stains of its many meals. — In-game description

217.name: Ornamental Shrublet
217.acquired_by: Possible drop from Sack of Silvered Light ( Pilgrim's Traverse Stones 1-30).
217.description: “ Summon forth your ornamental shrublet. Seeks either revenge or proliferation or both on its way to a new land. This ambulating plant appears to be an offshoot of the ornamental shrubs you encountered along Pilgrim's Traverse. Though it is unclear whether it desires revenge for its fallen parents or simply wishes to sow its seeds in faraway lands, it has seemingly decided to follow you. — In-game description

218.name: Orthos Craklaw
218.acquired_by: Random drop from Gold-tinged Sacks ( Eureka Orthos floors 71-100)
218.description: “ Summon forth your Orthos craklaw. May or may not have participated in famous battles which actually took place in history. Discovered in Eureka Orthos, this specimen of craklaw was imbued with magic in a bid to further harden its carapace. Though that experiment ended in failure, by way of a peculiar side effect, it has attained the power of flight. — In-game description

219.name: Outrunner
219.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement A Life of Adventure VI by getting every Disciple of War and Disciple of Magic to level 100.
219.description: “ A general-purpose machine, the outrunner can perform a wide variety of tasks, from the maintenance of facilities and devices to the elimination of dangerous creatures. Its design incorporates a monitor which displays comical expressions in lieu of a face, that it might be more approachable to the public. — In-game description

220.name: Pack Faehound
220.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 4).
220.description: “ Summon forth your pack faehound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours. Covered from muzzle to tail in an otherworldly silver coat, the faehound appears more akin to something out of a faerie tale than from the nether-reaches of the void. Yet do not be fooled by the beast's appearance, for she is an equal in strength to all but the highest ranking voidsent, her heart swollen with savagery from a lifetime leading a pack of her own. — In-game description

221.name: Pack Hellhound
221.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 3).
221.description: “ Summon forth your pack hellhound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours. Having commanded armies in the hellish darkness that is the void, this demonic beast will not soon submit at the feet of another. Which is why it is all the more surprising that the hound would allow someone on her back. — In-game description

222.name: Papa Paissa
222.description: “ Summon forth Papa Paissa. It's for a good cause. This exceptionally large paissa has sired no less than eight offspring, and in order to earn the coin to rear them, it chose to work as an adventurer's mount. By taking it into your service, you are supporting its adorable brood. — In-game description

223.name: Parade Chocobo
223.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Leaving a Better Impression II by getting 3,000 Player Commendations.
223.description: “ Summon forth your parade chocobo who, by the looks of him, has not marched in many parades. Originally purchased by the Adventurers' Guild for use in festival parades, this portly steed quickly wore out his welcome by devouring a moon's worth of fodder in a single turn of the sun. Unable to pay the price of upkeep, the guild passed the reins to someone more “commendable.” — In-game description

224.name: Peatie
224.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Peatie in Pink during Little Ladies' Day & Hatching-tide (2024). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
224.description: “ Summon forth Peatie, a goobbue maiden with a soft spot for peach blossoms. Hailing from a place where the peach trees bloom, this winsome goobbue maiden was found and taken in by the traveling entertainer Aldemund. After delighting the crowds on Little Ladies' Day, it made the decision to join you on your adventures in order to spread more cheer. — In-game description

225.name: Pegasus
225.acquired_by: Purchased from Enie in The Firmament for 4,200 Skybuilders' Scrips.
225.description: “ Summon forth a pegasus─winged white horse of legend. While rumors of a winged horse have graced ancient tomes for centuries, until recently, very little in the way of proof of their existence remained save the random feather or horseshoe housed in some remote monastery's reliquary. — In-game description

226.name: Petalodus
226.acquired_by: Random drop from gold persistent pot coffers or happy bunny coffers in The Occult Crescent: South Horn. Purchase from the Expedition Antiquarian in The Occult Crescent: South Horn for 99 Sanguinite.
226.description: “ Summon forth your petalodus, an ambulatory shark that thinks of you as a friend, not food. Though ancient Nymian legend speaks of mythical sharks possessed of arms and legs, it is unknown whether they bear any connection to the bipedal petalodus. Though its kind are ferocious by nature, for reasons unknown, this particular specimen treats you as an old friend...and here we are. — In-game description

227.name: Phaethon
227.acquired_by: Purchased from Nesvaaz in Radz-at-Han (10.6, 10) for 3 Burning Horns obtained from The Shifting Gymnasion Agonon.
227.description: “ Summon forth fiery Phaethon, a legendary beast of Corvosi myth. According to Corvosi myth, simply being near this fiery steed is akin to bathing in hot coals, and it is only through the ingenuity of alchemy that one can ride it unscathed. A nigh-identical being, created to draw a carriage in the heavens, is said to have existed in the world unsundered, but it is uncertain what manner of connection, if any, exists between the two beasts. — In-game description

228.name: Pilgrim's Protector
228.acquired_by: Purchase from Ose Wyd in Il Mheg for 99 First Light Relic Rare drop from Sack of First Light obtained from Pilgrim's Traverse challenge logs / The Final Verse / The Final Verse (Quantum).
228.description: “ Summon forth the pilgrim's protector, a wandering worshiper's best friend. A white-furred beast native to lands formerly belonging to the Kingdom of Voeburt. They can be domesticated if raised from birth, and were known to escort adherents of the Church of the First Light on pilgrimages. Due to its exceptional docility, this specimen is believed to be descended from such trained creatures. — In-game description

229.name: Pinky
229.acquired_by: Purchased from Nesvaaz in Radz-at-Han (10.6, 10) for 3 Exciting Tonics obtained from The Excitatron 6000. Can also drop directly in that dungeon.
229.description: “ Summon forth Pinky, an elephantine machine engineered to enrapture. Upon hearing that inebriated folk are wont to have visions of a delightful pink elephant, the Loporrits were inspired to make the creature a reality. The tale was, of course, simply a joke at their expense, but if this machine brings a smile to even one person, then their efforts will not have been in vain. — In-game description

230.name: Pod 602
230.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant for 300,000 MGP after clearing The Tower at Paradigm's Breach.
230.description: “ Summon forth your pod 602 mount. May leave you hanging, but will never let you go. Unless it malfunctions, or runs out of energy, or...you get the idea. Recovered from the ruins of the machine lifeforms, this diminutive white machina was created to provide YoRHa units with movement support. On account of this, it can easily transport one person...if not exactly in style or comfort. — In-game description

231.name: Polar Bear
231.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest A Treat to Beat the Heat during Moonfire Faire (2021). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
231.description: “ Summon forth your polar bear, a gentle giant with a soft spot for sweets. In search of ice to make frozen treats, the confectioner Nekeke traveled to an isle in the northern seas, where she encountered this hulking creature. A bite of her sweets was all it took for it to follow her back to Eorzea, where it subsequently grew fond of you. — In-game description

232.name: Portly Porxie
232.acquired_by: Purchased from Jul Oul in Il Mheg for 18 Fae Fancy after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Pixie society.
232.description: “ Summon forth your portly porxie. Bears you places to the tantalizing smell of cured meats. A prodigious porxie created by the Nu Mou Lugg Aenc for transportation purposes. Fond of sausages, it oft spends its free time in the curing chamber, and thus has come to take on the aroma. While comfortable to ride thanks to its soft curves, expect regular rumblings from its belly. — In-game description

233.name: Porxie King
233.acquired_by: Lawson Promotion (Japan) Gong Cha promotion for ordering 3 drinks (July - August, 2024 in North America, Europe, Oceania)
233.description: “ Unlike its kin, this porxie was born without the ability to cure the tempered. Rather than have it go to waste, however, it was made into a mount and given a crown─perhaps to evoke a sense of luxury and comfort. This specimen can be considered royalty among them. - Martineau — In-game description

234.name: Prototype Conveyor
234.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 8).
234.description: “ Call into battle your prototype magitek conveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics. It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so, not a single moon after the completion of their new conveyor system, imperial magitek engineers returned to the drawing board to improve upon their creation─replacing existing steel exoplates with high-quality steel exoplates. — In-game description

235.name: Prototype Roader
235.acquired_by: Awarded to the Top 100 players of each data center at the end of The Feast (Season 16).
235.description: “ Summon forth a prototype roader, one of the fastest ways to reach your destination while scaring the seven hells out of everyone on the way. Salvaged from the battlegrounds of Gyr Abania and restored by goblins, this devilishly speedy─yet decidedly unwieldy─contraption is said to have a mind of its own. In this case, however, that turn of phrase may have a ring of truth to it... — In-game description

236.name: Pteranodon
236.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Castle in the Sky by earning 500,000 points toward your skyward score as every Disciple of the Hand and Disciple of Land.
236.description: “ Summon forth your pteranodon, a winged scalekin that has existed since ancient times. In the course of feeding upon food scraps discarded at the Bounty , this creature grew so familiar with men as to allow riders upon its back. This goes to show that the way to a prehistoric creature's heart is through its stomach. — In-game description

237.name: Punutiy
237.acquired_by: Purchased from Pavli in Kozama'uka (x37, y16) for 18 Pelu Pelplume after achieving Rank 5 (Respected) with the Pelupelu society.
237.description: “ Summon forth your punutiy, and delight onlookers to no end with its winsome charm. Inhabiting the waters of Yok Tural, these gentle giants have been employed by men since olden days to tow boats on the continent's rivers and lakes. This specimen is particularly inquisitive, and having been imbued with the ability to fly, it has further developed a taste for travel. — In-game description

238.name: Qeziigural
238.acquired_by: Purchased from Uah'shepya in Solution Nine (X:8.6, Y:13.5) for 3 Twilight Gemstones obtained from Cenote Ja Ja Gural.
238.description: “ Summon forth your qeziigural, a winged golem whose name means “gold that flies” in the Mamool Ja tongue. — In-game description

239.name: Quaqua
239.acquired_by: Purchased from Trisassant in Old Sharlayan for 100 Aloalo Coins from Another Aloalo Island
239.description: “ Employed by a treasure hunter of Aloalo Island, this familiar was born of an early form of arcanima, an art which emerged in the south sea isles. The being's origin is attested by its predominantly wooden construction, a method which precedes the use of gemstones to create Carbuncles. — In-game description

240.name: Raigo
240.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Furious Fatalities by winning 60 Frontline, The Feast, Crystalline Conflict, or Rival Wings PVP matches with a GARO title.
240.description: “ Summon forth Raigo. Whether or not he heeds the call depends entirely on the number of bloodied laurels in your crown. The most daunting of Mado horses, Raigo eclipses its unholy brethren Goten and Ginga in both size and ferocity. As such, the creature will not suffer the burden of carrying a soul unbloodied, and therefore unworthy. — In-game description

241.name: Ramuh
241.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Eden's Verse: Refulgence (Savage).
241.description: “ Summon forth Ramuh. No, not that one. The one you fought in the Empty. But not the actual one. It is believed that Shiva's summoning in the Empty caused lightning-aspected aether left over from your battle with Ramuh to coalesce. The resultant crystal, when imbued with magic, gives rise to an entity which assumes the form of the Lord of Levin in all of his horse-legged, hulking glory. — In-game description

242.name: Rathalos
242.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Great Hunt (Extreme). Purchased from Smithy in Kugane for 50 Rathalos Scale+.
242.description: “ Summon forth your mighty Rathalos─a wyvern far, far from home. Many a brave hunter has attempted to topple this flame-belching beast from his fiery throne atop the forest, yet only a few can claim to have conquered the King of the Skies. — In-game description

243.name: Red Baron
243.description: “ Call into battle the Red Baron─Nero tol Scaeva's custom-made battle armor, now your custom-made battle armor. Constantly modified and improved by Nero himself, this warmachina of Garlean construct barely resembles the suit issued to tol Scaeva on the day of his promotion to tribunus. — In-game description

244.name: Red Hare
244.description: “ Summon forth the Red Hare─legendary steed known for both its unmatchable speed and its fiery red coat. Ganen was known for his imposing presence on the battlefield, a trait that can partially be attributed to his mount, the Red Hare─a lightning-swift steed magicked to stride the very heavens. This horse is said to be a direct descendant of the awe-inspiring stallion. Probably. — In-game description

245.name: Regalia Type-G
245.acquired_by: Purchased for 200,000 MGP from Ironworks Vendor in The Gold Saucer during the Collaboration Event A Nocturne for Heroes.
245.description: “ Summon forth your Regalia Type-G, ceruleum-powered magitek transportation vehicle crafted by Garlond Ironworks. To hear Cid tell it, equal parts elbow grease and gumption were all that was required to see the Type-G (for “Garlond”) fully operational...when, in all truth, the otherworldly carriage most likely required an amazing amount of reverse engineering to recreate. — In-game description

246.name: Resplendent Vessel of Ronka
246.acquired_by: Purchased from Tabeth in Eulmore, The Buttress (x10,y11) for 25,000,000 gil.
246.description: “ Summon forth the Resplendent Vessel of Ronka. Just like the Great Vessel of Ronka, but really shiny. After being stolen from ancient Ronkan ruins, this mystical urn passed through many an illicit hand before coming to be in yours. Blowing into the flute found within caused it to thus burgeon with the divine and take on a golden glow─an auspicious sign if ever there was one. — In-game description

247.name: Reveling Kamuy
247.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Pool of Tribute (Extreme). Purchased from Eschina for 99 Revel Totems.
247.description: “ Summon forth your reveling kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics. Upon receiving from his Kojin worshipers the offering of a sad, orphaned wolf pup, Susano proceeded to grant him the gift of flight, as well as an impressive coat of glowing fur, that he might be worthy of the revel. — In-game description

248.name: Rhiyes
248.acquired_by: Purchased from MGF Trader in The Gold Saucer for 410 MGF (Fall Guys Collaboration).
248.description: “ Created to serve as an obstacle in Blunderville, this mechanical rhinoceros has employed its ample weight and power to thwart the progress of many a hapless Bean. Fortunately for you, however, this example was programmed to shuttle you around rather than send you flying. — In-game description

249.name: Rising Phoenix
249.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest What Drives Us during The Rising (2023). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
249.description: “ Summon forth your Rising Phoenix, a symbol of rebirth and gratitude both. Created as a token of gratitude for the Warrior of Light, this majestic familiar assumes the likeness of the Phoenix, the immortal bird of legend. Upon death, the creature is said to rise again from its own ashes, on account of which it is revered as a symbol of rebirth. The fires of Ifrit─nay─the Phoenix have taken up residence in my heart, where they will continue to burn forevermore! - Jude — In-game description

250.name: Rolling Tankard
250.acquired_by: Purchased from Mizutt in Lakeland for 18 Hammered Frogment after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Dwarf society.
250.description: “ Summon forth your Rolling Tankard, a mighty warmachina built by the blacksmiths of Watts's Anvil. Based on a concept by the legendary Watts, this dwarven warmachina is propelled by a nine-cylinder radial ethanol engine. Its turret-mounted crystal cannon makes short work of sin eaters, while its arms can perform essential motions such as upending tankards. — In-game description

251.name: Rose Lanner
251.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Thok ast Thok (Extreme). Purchased from Bertana for 99 Hive Totems.
251.description: “ Summon forth the rose lanner. Favored of the primal Ravana, his wings pierce the night sky like a blade of moonlight. The ferocity of these birds is enough to give pause to the bravest warrior, and their keen talons cut through flesh as cleanly the Chandrahas themselves. Any who endeavor to mount the rose lanner must possess the savagery that defines the Wrath of the Colony. — In-game description

252.name: Round Lanner
252.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Thordan's Reign. Purchased from Bertana for 99 Heavens' Ward Helm Fragments.
252.description: “ Summon forth the round lanner. Favored of the primal King Thordan, he serves his master's knights dutifully. These birds are possessed of dignity equal to the noble personages whom they serve. Ancient Ishgardian knights often indulged themselves in falconry, and lanners were revered for their abilities, their lyncean eyes being well suited for sighting prey on the ground. — In-game description

253.name: Rroneek
253.acquired_by: Purchased from Splendors Vendor in Solution Nine (X:9.1, Y:13.2) for 100 Mount Tokens (effectively 100,000 Orange Gatherers' Scrips).
253.description: “ Found grazing the plains of Xak Tural, this stoutly built beastkin has been prized since ancient times on account of fairly every part of it being a useful resource. Owing to its importance in their lives, many nomadic tribes revere it as their guiding animal, and migrate alongside it with the seasons. — In-game description

254.name: Rubellite Carbuncle
254.description: “ Summon forth your Rubellite Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of rubellite geometry. Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large rubellite, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima. — In-game description

255.name: Ruby Gwiber
255.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Cinder Drift (Extreme). Purchased from C'intana for 99 Ruby Totems.
255.description: “ Summon forth your ruby gwiber, a draconic arcane entity. Believed to have been absorbed into the Ruby Weapon, this plate-clad being answers the call of a horn imbued with the power of an unknown primal. How the secrets of the horn came to be passed on to its summoner remains a mystery. — In-game description

256.name: SDS Fenrir
256.description: “ Call into battle the SDS Fenrir, a lore-bending battlebike that looks as if it was driven straight from an age unknown. Manufactured for use by the now-defunct Strife Delivery Service, this two-wheeled monstrosity's ceruleum engine howls like the silver wolf of legend as it propels its rider across desert and plain. — In-game description

257.name: Sabotender De La Luna
257.acquired_by: Purchased from Khloe Aliapoh for 1 Khloe's Gold Certificate of Commendation Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
257.description: “ Summon forth your sabotender de la luna mount, a prodigious cactuar raised on a diet of rousing tales. Under the patronage of its mistress, Rowena, this cactuar has led a pampered life. With the merchant being too busy to personally tend to it, however, its care fell to Khloe Aliapoh, whose attentive hand and rousing tales allowed it to grow into a large specimen with a luminescent blossom. — In-game description

258.name: Sabotender Emperador
258.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant for 2,000,000 MGP.
258.description: “ Summon forth Sabotender Emperador and bask in his desert sun radiance. No one knows exactly why the Manderville Gold Saucer was built to resemble a sabotender, just as no one knows why its mascot is a sabotender or why more than half of its drink menu features sabotender-themed “cact-tails.” This giant flying sabotender will not see you any closer to those answers, but it is fun to stare at. — In-game description

259.name: Safeguard System
259.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Front and Center V by winning 100 Frontline PvP matches.
259.description: “ Call into battle your Allagan safeguard system. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled. One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to maintain and protect their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere's processing unit was updated with the aid of Garlond Ironworks engineers to improve security. — In-game description

260.name: Sanuwa
260.acquired_by: Purchased from Luna Vanu in The Sea of Clouds for 200,000 gil after achieving Rank 7 (Sworn) reputation with the Vanu Vanu society.
260.description: “ Summon forth your sanuwa, specially bred and trained for riding by Gundu merchant Luna Vanu. Countless turns of the sun did Luna Vanu train this wild sanuwa to obey the orders of man, and for many moons did he wait for one he deemed worthy of taking up this noble cloudkin's reins. Wait, he did, until you arrived. — In-game description

261.name: Seikret
261.description: “ Summon forth your Seikret, the steed of choice for serious hunters. A beast of burden known for its strength and swiftness. Additionally possessed of a superior sense of smell, they are able to track prey over great distances, making them an indispensable hunting companion whence they hail. — In-game description

262.name: Serpent Warsteed
262.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement A Line in the Glade IV by winning 100 Frontline PvP matches with The Order of the Twin Adder (as the real Grand Company, not the one assigned during the match).
262.description: “ Summon forth your Order of the Twin Adder-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone. After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage during Frontline campaigns. — In-game description

263.name: Set Of Ceruleum Balloons
263.description: “ Summon forth your set of ceruleum balloons. Propulsion not included. Filled with gasified ceruleum, this festive assortment of balloons boasts enough buoyancy to lift a full-grown Roegadyn off the ground. However, it possesses no means of propulsion, and one is required to provide one's own wind magicks to move. — In-game description

264.name: Shadow Gwiber
264.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Minstrel's Ballad: Hades's Elegy. Purchased from Fathard for 99 Hades Totems.
264.description: “ Summon forth your shadow gwiber, a draconic arcane entity. Answering to a horn imbued with the power of a sorcerer of eld, this draconic arcane entity is believed to have been created by Emet-Selch on a whim─an act that would have barely taxed his powers as an ancient. — In-game description

265.name: Shadow Wolf
265.description: “ Summon forth your shadow wolf, a nightmare creature that could only be dreamed up by the darkest of souls. A spawn of darkest shadow, this dread wolf is said to have been created by an evil king to do battle with a hero of eld. Though the truth of the tale cannot be verified, the creature's eyes betray not a hint of hatred towards the Warrior of Light, whom it serves with unfaltering obedience. — In-game description

266.name: Shagcoat Cat
266.description: “ Summon forth your shagcoat cat, a gigantic-yet-gentle feline with a penchant for sporting a blue bowtie. Native to Tural, this enormous breed of cat is regarded as a gentle giant on account of its intelligence and mild temperament. While those who have gained its trust are permitted upon its back, would-be riders should be prepared to get fur everywhere when it sheds its shaggy coat during the warmer seasons. — In-game description

267.name: Shishioji
267.acquired_by: Purchased from Trisassant in Old Sharlayan (x12,y13.3) for 100 Shishu Coin from Another Mount Rokkon.
267.description: “ Summon forth Shishioji, a prince who just can't wait to be king (again). When the mighty Shishio, legendary auspice and king of the nue, was defeated, it shed a fragment of its malevolent will, which took form as this being. Possessing a will of its own, it recognizes you as its superior, and consents to bearing you upon its back. — In-game description

268.name: Shroud of Darkness
268.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of The Cloud of Darkness (Chaotic). Purchased from Uah'shepya in Solution Nine (8.6, 13.5) for 99 Clouddark Demimateria I.
268.description: “ Summon forth your shroud of Darkness, a lingering sliver of the Cloud of Darkness's eldritch raiment. A sliver of the eldritch raiment worn by the Cloud of Darkness. Appearing to be perpetuated by residual aether, it shows no sign of dissipating and allows its wearer to fly freely. Though soft to the touch like the finest wool, the fog that clings to it results in a persistent clamminess. — In-game description

269.name: Sil'dihn Throne
269.acquired_by: Purchased from Trisassant in Old Sharlayan for 100 Sil'dihn Silver from Another Sil'dihn Subterrane.
269.description: “ Summon forth your Sil'dihn throne. Once seating the rulers of Sil'dih, it now serves as your personal mode of transport. Discovered in a sector of the Sil'dihn Subterrane, this magnificent throne is believed to have been a spare. It moves in response to its master's will, but whether it does so via the spirits of Sil'dihns long dead or simple magicks is unknown. — In-game description

270.name: Silkie
270.acquired_by: Awarded from the achievement Dig Deep: The Sil'dihn Subterrane by unlocking all survey records in The Sil'dihn Subterrane.
270.description: “ Summon forth your silkie mount. Because cleanliness is next to cuteness. Encountered in the depths of the Sil'dihn Subterrane, this arcane entity was the familiar of former sultana Nanasha Ul Nasha, who created it to keep the royal palace squeaky clean. Contrary to its appearance, the pom on the tail is the actual being rather than the mouselike creature. — In-game description

271.name: Skyslipper
271.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Eden's Gate: Sepulture (Savage).
271.description: “ Summon forth your skyslipper, the greatest mechanical marvel to ever resemble a shoe. Once belonging to the imperial family, this unique craft was abandoned in a grotto by its owners due to a malfunction. It was later retrieved via airship and stored in the Crystal Tower, where it lay until its recent rediscovery and restoration by artisans of the Crystalline Mean. — In-game description

272.name: Sleipnir
272.description: “ Summon forth Sleipnir─undying steed of the elder primal Odin. His coat is as dark as void, while his eyes glow a sanguine red. Blessed by the elder primal himself, Sleipnir will forever remain loyal to those who have proven themselves worthy. In addition to being fearless in battle, the dark steed is also able to manipulate his corporeal form to accommodate any rider, large or small. — In-game description

273.name: Snowman
273.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Starlit Smiles during Starlight Celebration (2020). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
273.description: “ Summon forth a behatted and begloved embodiment of festive cheer. Scholars maintain that the tradition of building snowmen originated in Gyr Abania, where they were used to encourage blessings such as “cold” and “snow.” Considering that the region is almost entirely covered in arid desert, how the snowmen were built in the first place remains a mystery. — In-game description

274.name: Snowstreamer
274.acquired_by: Twitch campaign for buying 3 streamer subscriptions (Dec 2024).
274.description: “ Summon forth your snowstreamer. Guaranteed not to inconveniently melt while you are inside. Hollow on the inside and sustained by the power of eternal ice, this snowman garbed in fetching purple promises to keep its rider cool even in the hottest of climes. Rumor holds it is the perfect companion for those who wish to share their adventures with others, as well as those who wish to cheer others along on theirs. — In-game description

275.name: Sophic Lanner
275.acquired_by: Random drop upon completion of Containment Bay P1T6 (Extreme). Purchased from Bertana for 99 Goddess Totems.
275.description: “ Summon forth your Sophic lanner. A once faithful servant to a fickle goddess. History tells us that disruption in balance 'twixt good and evil will invariably result in suffering. The noble lanner serves to restore that balance by placing upon the goddess Sophia's scales the weights of equilibrium─most commonly depicted as our heroes of legend. — In-game description

276.name: Spectral Statice
276.acquired_by: Awarded from the achievement: Good-willed Hunting by unlocking all conservation records on Aloalo Island.
276.description: “ This mischief-loving faerie was originally companion to a scholar, but her aether refused to disperse in the wake of her master's death. After enduring a dull existence for long years, she found in you someone who could provide her with excitement, and thus did she weave an avatar of herself to join you on adventures. — In-game description

277.name: Spriggan Stonecarrier
277.description: “ Summon forth your spriggan stonecarrier. Lives to carry ore, eggs, and you. Grown to a prodigious size by virtue of its appetite, this spriggan was choking on a chunk of ore when it was found and saved by a band of miners. Seeking to repay the kindness of men, it took to carrying their burdens, which apparently includes men themselves. — In-game description

278.name: Starlight Bear
278.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest Starlight Stakeout during Starlight Celebration (2017). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
278.description: “ Summon forth your Starlight bear, and delight the younglings to no end. Unlike his wild cousins, Kochab the bear can be relied upon to delight folk rather than tear them apart. Raised from a cub by Celebrant Baenfaeld, he has mastered the art of Starburst-lobbing, a skill that proved useful in hunting down thieving treants. — In-game description

279.name: Starlight Steed
279.acquired_by: Reward for completing the Seasonal Event Quest The Ghost of Starlight Present during Starlight Celebration (2022). Final Fantasy XIV Online Store - ($12 / £7.44 / €9 / ¥1320)
279.description: “ Summon forth your Starlight steed, which, despite being an illusion, can bring very real joy to one and all. The reindeer Blitzen, visiting from Sharlayan, gifted you this ridable glamour as a show of gratitude for your kind aid. From the creature itself to the presents, all is recreated in such impressive detail that it could only be considered a Starlight miracle. — In-game description

280.name: Storm Warsteed
280.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement A Line in the Storm IV by winning 100 Frontline PvP matches with The Maelstrom (as the real Grand Company, not the one assigned during the match).
280.description: “ Summon forth your Maelstrom-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone. After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage during Frontline campaigns. — In-game description

281.name: Striped Ray
281.acquired_by: Purchased from Shikitahe in The Ruby Sea for 12 Kojin Sango after achieving Rank 8 (Bloodsworn) reputation with the Kojin society.
281.description: “ Summon forth your striped ray, a majestic creature native to the Ruby Sea. Raised and trained by the Kojin, this striped ray has the same mellow temperament as its original masters. Its flat body works in like fashion to the aether-imbued wings of an airship, allowing it to catch water- and wind-aspected aether to glide through both sea and sky with ease. — In-game description

282.name: Sunforged
282.acquired_by: Guaranteed drop upon completion of Abyssos: The Eighth Circle (Savage).
282.description: “ Summon forth your sunforged. Its searing flames consume all─with the exception of its owner, thankfully. A product of the genius mind of Hephaistos, this fiery phantom creation combines two concepts─a flying snake and an immortal bird─and can shapeshift as the situation demands. Only the individual it recognizes as its master may ride it unscathed. — In-game description

283.name: Sunspun Cumulus
283.description: “ Summon forth the sunspun cumulus. It is unclear whether its previous owner was a boy with a tail or simply a monkey. There is but one man in all of Hydaelyn who can create such a mystical masterpiece, and it is said he resides upon a misty peak hidden within the mountain ranges of Doma. Crafted by stitching together dozens of smaller clouds dyed golden by the sun, this cumulus is said to bring good fortune to its rider. — In-game description

284.name: Syldra
284.acquired_by: Reward for purchasing the Collector's Edition or Digital Collector's Edition of Stormblood. (account-wide)
284.description: “ Summon forth Syldra. Even in death, she would want to help. Legends say there once lived a kindly sea dragon who befriended a pirate, and that their friendship knew no bounds. This is not that sea dragon; however, with a little time and caring, who is to say that a similar relationship cannot be forged? ※Sea dragons have no relation to actual dragons. — In-game description

285.name: Torgal
285.acquired_by: Acquired during the Collaboration Event The Path Infernal
285.description: “ According to the wandering minstrel, the beast who appeared to aid the stranded Clive was a guiding spirit born of its master's memory. So impressed was the ever-insightful musician by the creature, he decided to create this faithful facsimile in hopes that it might also serve as your loyal companion. A more dependable comrade one would be hard-pressed to find. - Alphinaud — In-game description

286.name: Traveling Supporter
286.acquired_by: PvP Series 4 Malmstones - Level 25 reward Purchased from Crystal Quartermaster - Wolves' Den Pier for 5,000
286.description: “ Summon forth your traveling supporter. Proof that there is nothing a pair of bunny ears can't improve. This advanced bipedal machina was found wandering the Carteneau Flats by a quartermaster of the Eorzean Alliance. While it bears a striking resemblance to Allagan clockwork soldiers, it appears to have been enhanced by unknown hands (or paws). — In-game description

287.name: Triceratops
287.acquired_by: Complete the achievement Nuts for Nutsy by defeating 2,000 A Rank Elite Marks and 1,000 S Rank Elite Marks in Shadowbringers areas.
287.description: “ Summon forth your triceratops seemingly from a page right out of prehistory. In defiance of its bulk, this prehistoric horned beast has been rendered capable of flight courtesy of its saddle. Employing Ronkan ingenuity, the singular contraption was modified from an artifact discovered within ancient ruins by the moogle Nutsy, fearless leader of the clan of her namesake. — In-game description

288.name: Troll
288.acquired_by: Purchased from Khloe Aliapoh for 1 Khloe's Gold Certificate of Commendation Purchased from Faux Commander in Idyllshire (x5.7,y6.1) for 600 Faux Leaf
288.description: “ Summon forth your troll mount, a gentle giant native to the northern seas. Contrary to their savage appearance, trolls are highly intelligent creatures. Sharlayan scholars once sought to teach them sign language, and on account of this specimen's friendly nature, it is believed that it was a subject in that experiment. — In-game description

289.name: True Griffin
289.acquired_by: Purchased from Madhura in Gyr Abania for 18 Ananta Dreamstaff after achieving Rank 8 (Bloodsworn) reputation with the Ananta society.
289.description: “ Summon forth your true griffin, a noble winged beast native to the hidden reaches of Abalathia's Spine. Covered in the pristine white feathers representative of a true griffin, this native of Abalathia's Spine has been trained by Giff, one of the Ala Mhigan Resistance's most competent handlers. So tame is the creature that it will even emit powerful bursts of air on command. — In-game description

290.name: Turali Snowman
290.acquired_by: Awarded from the Achievement Worqor and Peace V: Guide any of the three Grand Companies to a total of 100 victories at Worqor Chirteh.
290.description: “ Summon forth your Turali snowman, and frolic as only Ryoqor Terteh can. A snowman designed in the likeness of Ryoqor Terteh, one of the playful spirits that call Worqor Zormor home. Said spirit is known to disguise itself as a snowman in order to sneak into settlements─a trick which you can now also perform thanks to the enchantment which allows this imitation to carry a single person. — In-game description

291.name: Twintania
291.acquired_by: Purchased from any Calamity Salvager for 15 Gold Chocobo Feathers. Gold Chocobo Feathers can be obtained through the Recruit a Friend campaign, or through World Population Balancing Incentives.
291.description: “ Summon forth Twintania, an ancient wyvern who secretly dreams of freedom...and devouring you. Bound to eternal thralldom via an Allagan neurolink, this ancient wyvern from the southern continent of Meracydia will remain a loyal servant as long as you possess its identification key. — In-game description

292.name: Ty'aitya
292.acquired_by: Purchased from Edelina in Mor Dhona (x22,y5) for 500 Turali Bicolor Gemstone Voucher (effectively 50,000 Bicolor Gemstones)
292.description: “ Its name meaning “the sound of playing in the treetops” in Xbr'aal, this herbivorous beastkin is capable of gliding impressive distances owing to the skin that stretches between its wrists and ankles. Fiercely territorial, it is known to attack even large predators using the bladelike cartilage protruding from the side of its hands. — In-game description

293.name: Typhon
293.acquired_by: Purchased from the Gold Saucer Attendant in Gold Saucer for 750,000 MGP.
293.description: “ Summon forth Typhon, hideous voidsent aberration and standout employee at the Manderville Gold Saucer. Since his summoning from the void by the Thaumaturges' Guild, Typhon has experienced his share of ups and downs. Through an employment opportunity at the Manderville Gold Saucer, however, the gaping-mawed horror─described by close acquaintances as quiet and reserved─has (figuratively speaking) landed back on his feet. — In-game description

294.name: Tyrannosaur
294.acquired_by: Random drop from Anemos Lockboxes obtained from FATEs in The Forbidden Land, Eureka Anemos.
294.description: “ Summon forth your tyrannosaur and experience firsthand a lost time when scalekin ruled the world. Alarmed scholars report that the “T-Rex”—as it is called by those short on ink—has gained the power of flight through continued exposure to the Isle of Val's turbulent aether. Despite its ferocious nature, some still approach it, insisting it can be tamed by an adventurer of great strength. — In-game description

295.name: UFO
295.acquired_by: Complete the quest Gentlemen at Heart, the finale of the Somehow Further Hildibrand Adventures.
295.description: “ Summon forth your UFO, and experience the sensation of an alien abduction. While appearing to be identical to PuPu's starship, this replica lacks certain functionalities such as a matter duplication facility, which, in light of recent events, is probably for the best. It is also unable to shrink you to a size to fit in the cockpit, meaning you do not so much ride as you are dangled around in its tractor beam. — In-game description

296.name: Ufiti
296.acquired_by: Purchased from Enie in The Firmament for 8,400 Skybuilders' Scrips.
296.description: “ Summon forth your ufiti. May carry you to high ground for your own safety. Having survived a cull of its kind by bloodthirsty adventurers on its native Diadem, this ufiti mastered the art of riding the winds, that it might set forth on a journey to find a worthy leader.
